Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patty S
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for first time at the end of March with my daughter and niece, selected this hotel based on Frommer's review and other traveler's reviews. Would highly recommend! Ditto to everyone's comments about the staff as well as the restaurant and rooms. Claudio was helpful every step of our day excursions and even loaned us an adaptor for our US electronics. Although not central to the hustle and bustle, it is in a safe location convenient to public transport - although we always would 'just miss' the 360 bus connector which became the ongoing joke! The restaurant food was delicious and a great bargain, and the complimentary breakfast was well stocked. I can't say enough good things about our overall experience, which was a 4-night stay in the midst of a whirlwind London/Rome/Paris excursion. We had a triple room - three singles - and despite my fear that the European rooms are small by US standards, we had plenty of room for three women with lots of stuff! To respond to an earlier comment, there is grafitti EVERYWHERE in this city, so don't be put off by there being grafitti near the Del Muse. The are we felt was residential and we walked home from the bus stop in the evening and always felt completely safe. Thank you to the staff for making our stay so very memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Needs repainting, otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: JVa70
Reviews.Content: Good things - Accessibly: 360 bus stop from Termini 2 min from the hotel door, 19 tram stop (to Vatican) 10 min, train station to Piazza di Popolo 6 min, taxi to Fiumicino airport for 8 persons (+driver) 70 Eur/50min drive - Breakfast and reasonably priced restaurant - Information provided by the staff at the reception - Gluten free meals/pasta (breakfast quite limited) Things to improve - The hotel needs investment, such a hotel in e.g. Germany would be 2* - The hotel needs lots of fresh paint and general cleaning (this not not to say that the rooms were dirty, they just need get rid of proofs that for the last 10+ years nobody has used paint there)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: miower
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Del Muse last week. We decided to save money and stay a little further out of the centre, which was the right decision. The maps and bus information the hotel provide is very useful and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Screename2009
Reviews.Content: Vey helpful staff - provided support before arrival with directions/information. Detailed map of Rome given to us on arrival. Lots of free information available about tours/sights. Local transport information made available in each room. Internet and printing facilities. Clean rooms. Approx 20mins by bus to Rome Termini from main square (approx 10mins walk) where you can catch the tram and other bus connections. (Italian bus service can be late/delayed so leave extra time).

Reviews.Title: “3* hotel with 5* qualities”
Reviews.Author: kennetti
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 3rd visit to this great hotel.Everything you could wish for in a city hotel without the noise and high prices.Yes it is a bus ride into Termini but this is wonderfully compensated for by the friendly staff,especially Paolo and Ali in the dining room where you can get a four course meal for 18 euros -this price has been frozen for the last 5 years.Rooms are clean and well air-conditioned-in the summer you can relax in their huge garden and also dine al fresco.Breakfast is huge.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: operagav
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Muse and our 1st stay in Rome. Took the terravision bus from Ciampino airport to Rome (even bought the return ticket while queuing to board in Liverpool airport!) which was direct & easy. Got the bus (306?) from the Terminale to piazza delle muse (the last stop & takes approx 20 mins) - make sure you wait at the right stop as this bus goes in 2 directions - one to Zama & one to Muse! ( The sign at the stop has an arrow on it showing which direction it's going). Passed the hotel on the bus & a very short walk back to it in a quiet, leafy area. Great welcome at reception & were also given a sheet with lots of helpful hints about getting into Rome ( can get a bus back from piazza delle muse or from Piazza Hungaria - 10 min walk, straight to Colosseum or Trastevere; or about the same walk to the train for 2 stops into the centre of the city, only 1 metro stop away from the Spanish steps etc!) and they also gave us a really detailed map of the city, including the area around the hotel, which was much easier to use than either of the ones from our guide books! If you're going to hop on & off the metro, trains &/bus a few times a day, then it's definitely worth getting a day travelcard (from any tabacchi) for only 4 euros! Breakfast was great - loads of choice with all kinds of croissants, Danish pastries, biscotti, cereals, bacon & scrambled egg, boil your own eggs, toast, continental style stuff & yoghurts, fresh fruit......! One handy hint - if your room has metal shutters - look for a switch on the wall which raises them electronically (we were trying to lift them for a while before we realised!) Our room overlooked the garden where breakfast is served later in the season & it looked like this would be lovely! Wi-fi in the rooms & could also use the computers/printers in reception if you liked. Room was clean & a nice, roomy bathroom with shower & bidet. I would definitely recommend staying at the Muse - it was lovely to stay a little outside of the city (& would certainly pay a lot more for this kind of hotel in the centre) but transport links were good & could get around easily. Rome itself was absolutely beautiful - so much to see/do!

Reviews.Title: “Truely Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob H
Reviews.Content: In a quiet location out from the city centre, but only a couple of mins walk to the bus & tram stop. Can highly reccomend the Taverna Rosinni restaurant only a 10 min walk from hotel. There is also a fantastic ice cream parlour, 5 mins walk from the hotel - that the staff informed us of - it is well worth a visit! Breakfast was most satisfactory, and a great selection of food on offer. All staff in the hotel are to be commended. Nothing was too much bother, they were generous and offered a first class service. On arrival, we found the room clean and spacious, with a pleasant veranda. Our room was cleaned daily, and had a nice, moddern decor. If you are staying for 3 days - buy an 11 euro travel ticket from a local newspaper stand. We were very impressed with this hotel & it's staff, and would certainly reccomend it to others - we hope you have as good-a-time as we did!:)

Reviews.Title: “would definitley recommend”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel to be friendly and comfortable with first rate food on offer,once we found our bearings it was a nice walk to the city centre about approx 50mins.(if you like to walk).But there was a bus service which the stop was only 200 yards from the hotel and got you to the termini in about 15mins,where you can catch the metro or other bus connections.We were a party of 6 and we all recomend the roma pass which you can get from the tourist information centre which will get you into the vatican without queing, and 1 other museum +the bus sytem also the sightseeing bus is good value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel, fantastic food!”
Reviews.Author: kellytime
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little out of the way but good transport links mean you are only a short bus ride away. We were a bit lost when first arriving at Termini so eventually got a taxi for less than 10 euros! Well worth it after travelling. Otherwise we bought a 3 day bus/tram pass for 11 euros and used the 360 bus back n fore. We had read reviews about the food and we ended up eating at the restaurant 2 nights of our 3 night stay. After sight seeing all day we just wanted to be fed n watered not bus it back down to the centre. Well worth it. Good friendly service in the restaurant, excellent food and good value - 3 courses for 18 euros and nice house wine. We ate in a little restaurant near Pantheon on our last night. Full of locals, so we thought oh this should be good! Terrible service and very mediocre food! So wish we had stayed in the restaurant! Breakfast was excellent also. Plenty of choice, not so many hot options if you like your full cooked english but as far as continental brekkies go, this was fab! Lots of pastries n cakes if you have a sweet tooth like me!Cereal options, ham, cheeses, breads, yoghurts etc etc The room was spacious, not too hot and not too cold, had a small balcony and a lovely clean bathroom. The shower wasnt upto much but it did the job. The room was a bit dated but clean which is the main thing. We had the Waltons staying next to us and the kids were quite noisy at times and did wake us up one morning. Also the opposite side of us we had a loud Itallian man who used to have loud animated telephone conversations at 8am! Ok im on holiday to sight see and not lay in bed but surely people should hae some respect for their neighbours?! The hotel staff were polite and friendly and reception were useful with directions etc. The only negative point apart from the thin walls and hearing every noise from neighbouring rooms is that 1 day we went back a little earlier to rest before going back out. It was around 5pm and there were workmen working in he corridor by our room. They were banging for approxiamately 1 hour. We did not complain about this as it was a normal time of the day, we just found it a bit annoying! Also we were not informed of the 'City Tax' of 2 euros per person per night until we were checking out - so keep some money aside for checking out! The lifts are also a little small but an experience! All in all this hotel was excellent value and a great base for seeing Rome. I would definetly consider staying here again. I think this hotel is perfect for people going to watch rugby or other sports in the olympic stadium whoich isnt too far from Delle Muse.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful Hotel, would highly recommend *****”
Reviews.Author: Sara J
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel in the centre of Rome before checking reviews, and then to my horror found terrible reviews on many sites! So researched here and found this hotel. It not only confirmed all the great reviews, but exceeded expectations. The hotel is more like a 4 star, however communal areas with a little improvement would raise this level, the rooms however are fine, beds comfortable, bathrooms modern and spotless, tv, internet, air conditioning and great views from the top floor (which is where I asked to go) I even had a terrace outside my room, which would have been lovely in the summer, but even in the winter was nice to take in the buzz of rome in the mornings. The staff are very friendly, and do everything they can to make your stay comfortable, from clean linen daily, clean rooms and bathrooms, making beds, to excellent buffet breakfast where you are asked if everything is ok, and no trouble if you want anything different (though the breakfast buffet has just about any possible taste you cn imagine available-from cakes, cereals, breads to cooked meats, eggs and cheeses.) The evening menu is very affordable and tasy, even if it is simple. Definitely adequate after a long journey. They hotel is run by italians that enjoy their job, and the front of house helped with bookings for sightseeing and all other phone enquires where I needed italian speaking support. The area is a quiet and safe residential area an easy ride into town on the bus just outside the hotel door. (same side of road as hotel) Will come back here for sure. This was a nice safe place as I travel alone with children, and Rome is a hectic city...watch your pockets, I didnt have any trouble in the city, but the crowds outside the attractions can be marauding. Top tip...book sights online before hand, Queues can be anything up to 3 hours for entrance to vatican museums, or colisseum. I took a chance at an off peak time at vatican, and that was still an hour queue...in the rain! Could be baking in the summer though as you are queueing with no shade against a high wall. Finally a big thank you to Nino and the other staff who looked after us at the Delle Muse. We had a great time. Sara Taylor, sussex UK

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: MrWCheadle
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome to watch England play Italy in the '6 Nations Rugby' tournement. Rome was experiencing its heaviest snowfall in 25 years and due to this we were quoted 60 Euros for the 15 minute taxi ride from the Termini to the hotel, we decided to get the #360 bus for 1 Euro which more or less dropped us outside the door. Staff on arrival couldnt have been more welcoming, spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful in providing directions to the Rugby Stadium. The room was basic but more than adequate, lovely hot shower, clean sheets, spotless bathroom. There is a TV but only CNN for English speakers. We decided to eat in the hotel restaurant rather than brave the weather and at 18Euros for a 3 course meal it was both excellent value and delicious. On the sunday we jumped on the same bus back into Rome centre for the 15 minute journey and enjoyed the many sights Rome has to offer. The Hotel Della Muse it a lovely, homely Hotel and i couldnt recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Delle Muse was Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: chris m
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse, was splendid. The staff was the key highlight of Delle Muse. By the time we left, we felt like we had acquired a bit of a family. Each and every member of the staff was friendly, accommodating, warm, helpful, and great. From the kitchen, to the cleaning staff, to the front desk, everyone was really great. The hotel is located a bit outside of city center, which was fine for my fiance and I, because we wanted something a bit more quiet. We walked to City Center numerous times, and the walk was great. There are local stores, shops, and conviences very close to the hotel. We didnt take the bus, but chose to ride in cabs, this can obviously be a bit more expensive but the cab ride to the forum was only 10 minutes.. Breakfest in the morning was great - buffet style, free cappicinos!! For a three star hotel, these guys knock it out of the park... I would highly recomend staying at DELLE MUSE!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL / OVER AND ABOVE...”
Reviews.Author: Emma G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldnt choose the word to best describe our stay at the Hotel Delle Muse in Rome, so we opted for both of the above. This hotel rose above and beyond my expectations from the off. Mr Lazar and the team at Delle Muse bent over backwards to ensure that our visit was just as we had hoped. I forgot to pack an adapter for my electrical items and the Reception desk addressed my problem immediately. Nothing was too much for the staff. I booked this 3 day City Break as a surprise for my husband's birthday and after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I thought this would be a good experience. I was not prepared for it to be fantastic, so a huge bonus! Our room was nice, spacious and very clean. The restaurant staff were attentive and always provided service with a smile. The breakfast buffet selection is wide, catering for every taste along with the evening menu. The hotel is a little way out of the centre of Rome, but my husband and I were able to find our way around with no problem as the hotel are very informative and provide you with maps and transportation information. The 360 bus stop is 200 meters away from the hotel and takes you directly to Termini Station where you can take other buses to your chosen sites. Personally speaking, being slightly out of the hustle and bustle of a major city is quite refreshing as you get to experience another side of this beautiful city, a more relaxed atmosphere (which is nice after long days)! I have already recommended this hotel to family, so would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone else thinking of booking here. We look forward to returning to Delle Muse. Thank you for everything - great hotel and great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LyndzHen
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we knew it was not exactly smack bang in the centre, but this appealed to us as we like walking. It took 40 minutes to get into the centre, the weather was lovely (it was December!) and we worked off the gelato we had at the Trevi Fountain! The staff in the hotel are by far the best thing about this lovely hotel. Excellent service and nothing was a problem, the speak fantastic English and are very imformative. The room had a balcony and although a little small, it was clean and we had no complaints. The breakfast was a great selection and would set us up for the day. All in all we loved Rome and will go back, and when we do, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Rapt0r
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find however it is quite far from most of the action and tourists spots. You would need to take a +-15min bus ride, however waiting for the bus was more annoying than the ride itself. The hotel is old and dated, pretty much the same as most in Rome however the owner and staff were extremely helpful and polite. Possibly the best breakfast that i have had in Italy. Must try out Pippo's icecream 2 streets away as well as the take away pizza place next to Pippo's.

Reviews.Title: “Service, room, value, restaurant--All great!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKurt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel tired and hungry, but past the closing hour of the hotel's restaurant. Even though we said that we didn't want to keep the kitchen staff over their time, the front desk person and the waiter insisted that we sit down in the dining room and order anything we wanted from the menu. More on the restaurant later. Our twin room (#371) was at the end of the hall and very quiet. A small terrace overlooked the garden area. The room was spacious enough, as was the obviously updated bathroom. In the center of Rome, this hotel's rates would be double or more than what they are outside of the center. We had no problems with the bus to or from the city center. During the least busy hours, the ride took about 15 minutes; during busier times you might add about 5-7 minutes. The bus from the city center ends at Piazza delle Muse, which is a 2-minute walk to the hotel. The Parioli neighborhood is very quiet and beautiful, the kind of area that you might find yourself saying that you wouldn't mind living there. A short distance from the hotel is Viale dei Parioli, which--with its shops and restaurants--makes for a pleasant evening walk. The biggest surprise was the quality of the hotel's restaurant for lunch and dinner. Unaccustomed to hotel restaurants, I was a bit hesitant. But the quality of the food was excellent. Recommended are the pennette alla vodka, spaghetti cacio e pepe, tortellini alla salvia, and fettina di manzo alla pizzaiola. The complimentary prosecco before each meal was a nice touch. A special mention goes to our waiter, Ali, who was helpful, efficient, and humorous. Unless you want to be in the middle of hectic Rome, there's no reason not to choose Hotel delle Muse.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel at a high price”
Reviews.Author: Liriodendron10
Reviews.Content: I've choose this hotel do to the fact that I needed to be nearby a business conference. The hotel is a small and old one but it was clean and friendly enough. The area is quiet and the room was big enough with an old furniture. The elevator was the smallest that I experienced in my life. The most appreciated was the breackfast, plenty of good food and good coffee. The staff were friendly enough and wifi free of charge or I would say thet is included in the accommodation price. It is far from center - minimum 2 transportation vehicles - 30 min. 1Euro/person. A very good restaurant nearby was Taverna Rossini - italian specific with good food and very good service. It is wortth mentioning also that the hotel have a very nice outdoor terrace for the breackfast but it is used only during summer so I've seen it but I didn't experienced. For a business trip is ok but if you are looking a romantic travel...better find something else

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Sally N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money, very clean, super breakfast and amazingly helpful and friendly reception staff. Good for a short stay in Rome but be prepared to walk or use public transport as it away from the main visiting sites. However the bus stop is only a couple of minutes walk away and you also have the option to use the tram which is about five minutes away. Only slight minus point was the shower as the pressure and hot water were a bit sporadic but overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms_adham
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Keeping in mind that it is a 3-star hotel and inexpensive it was beyond expectations. Clean, neat and very helpful and kind staff. Big buffet breakfast catering to all tastes. The only drawback would be the location; it is a bit far from the city center, but the good news is that it is only 2 minutes walking from the bus stop that takes you directly to the main station. It is about 20 minutes by bus. The bus is supposed to run every 10 minutes but actually it does not! In the evenings you had to wait sometimes for 20 or even 30 minutes for the bus to come. I read a couple of bad reviews of this hotel, but they are all falsified, the hotel is so clean and the neighbourhood is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Bob 1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel delle Muse for four nights, prior to boarding a cruise ship at Civitavecchia. Our transfers from Fiumicino airport were very cheap. (A pre-booked ticket for the Terravision coach to Roma Termini costs €4, and the bus to Muse costs €1 – total €5 per person). However, our flight from London to Fiumicino was delayed, so we had to wait one hour for the next Terravision transfer bus from the Airport to Roma Termini. Then, we had a long wait for the bus to Muse. By the time we reached the hotel with our luggage, it was almost 8 pm and we were tired. For convenience, it might have been better to ask the hotel to arrange a car transfer from the airport costing €50. The situation could only improve – and fortunately it did. Check-in was prompt and welcoming and the receptionist advised us that dinner was available in the garden restaurant. The restaurant offers a set menu costing €18, which varies nightly and includes a pasta course, a meat or fish course and dessert. However, my wife must adhere to a gluten-free diet. The hotel offered gluten-free pasta, but we decided to order à la carte. Everything was reasonably priced and the menu options included a massive cold buffet of salad and vegetable items. We were so impressed with our dinner that we decided to eat at the hotel on the next three evenings. Breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was more than adequate and comprised breads, cakes & pastries, cold meats and cheeses, yogurts and fruit juices. Hot options included boiled eggs (cook them yourself), scrambled eggs, bacon and canned cocktail sausages. The hotel is in an old building, which adds to its charm. The lift (elevator) is really tiny, with barely sufficient space for a passenger and one suitcase. However, our double room on the third floor was very comfortable and spotlessly clean, with a tiled floor, quiet air-conditioning, electrically controlled blinds, telephone, LCD television, and ample wardrobe space. The hotel offers free wi-fi internet, which worked perfectly in our room. The en suite facilities included a shower and bidet, but no bath. Although many of the hotel’s guests come from the UK or USA, the television in our room (#362) had no English language channels. Ideally, the channel line-up should include Sky News, CNN and BBC World, all of which are available in Italy. The reception and restaurant staff, all of whom spoke English, were very helpful. The receptionist supplied maps and advised us about sightseeing options. He also warned us about pickpockets (even though we were aware of the problem, following our previous visits to Rome). Far too many Roman hotels and restaurants are sub-standard and overcharge tourists. That does not apply to Hotel delle Muse, which provides excellent value for money. My wife and I dined at the hotel on four evenings. Even though each our dinners included three courses, wine, a litre of sparkling water and coffees, the total bill for extras was only €160 (€20 per person per night including service). Red or white house wine, costing €4 for 500 ml or €6 per litre was very drinkable. The location of Hotel delle Muse is an advantage – but could be a disadvantage. The hotel is in a quiet residential area, and we were glad to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. However, extensive road works and a nearby construction site meant that the pathways were closed, so it was difficult to use wheeled suitcases. (That is a temporary problem). Buses on Route 360 tend to be delayed in heavy traffic at peak times, so you might have to wait a while at Termini railway station. Incidentally, buses from Termini to Muse stop on the main road, by the side of the station forecourt – NOT in the bus station. On your first visit to the hotel, it is best to remain on the bus until the end of the route. Then, walk back to the hotel. On subsequently journeys, it is easier to disembark one stop before Muse terminus – and walk a few yards up the hill to the hotel. Tips: It is very easy to travel in and around Rome. However, you cannot purchase tickets on buses or trams. You should purchase your tickets from a newsagent, tobacconist or vending machine before you board the bus or tram. Then, you must insert your ticket in the yellow validation machine on the bus or tram. Ticket options include: B.I.T €1. Standard one-way ticket - valid for one Metro ride or 75 minutes on all buses and trams within Rome. B.I.G. €4. Daily ticket, valid until midnight for unlimited Metro, bus, tram and train travel within Rome B.T.I. €11. Three-day tourist ticket, valid for everything listed above. C.I.S. €16. Weekly ticket You can also purchase regional versions of these tickets, for travel within and outside the city. For instance, a B.I.R.G. one-day regional ticket for Zones A & B is excellent value at €6 and will take you from Rome to towns such as Tivoli, Grottaferrata and Frascati. You can purchase regional tickets from the ATAC ticket office in the pedestrian subway at Termini station (use the subway entrance, close to the Route 360 bus stop).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LJinSC
Reviews.Content: The price was reasonable. The rooms were fine. The breakfast was great. The staff was excellent. The restaurant was good, with everything cooked to order. The only concern for some may be the location. Nice neighborhood but a long walk and/or bus ride to major attractions. No fault of the hotel but the 360 bus simply did not run on schedule. If you are not in a rush to do things it is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: sherry9453
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our short stay at the Hotel Delle Muse. Giorgio and his family/staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Before our trip to Rome, I corresponded thru email with Giorgio & Claudio to arrange transfers from the airport to the hotel, & also transfers to/from Civitivecchia (port for our cruise departure). They responded quickly to every email I sent & answered my questions--our arrangements were all set before we arrived. The restaurant at the hotel served delicious and reasonably priced food--so much so, that we returned for dinner 2 weeks later after our cruise was over just to have dinner there again! We would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in a clean and well-run facility.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place”
Reviews.Author: kevin m
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several days at the end of Oct and found this to be a ideal location. Away from the crowds yet 10-15 minutes by bus to the city. The buses and street cars make it very easy to get around provided one spends a few minutes learning the routes. The hotel staff is friendly and informative and knowledgeable of the city as well as the surrounding area. Nino pointed out several excellent restaurants in the area. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “feeling at home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: idan P
Reviews.Content: In a quiet residential neighborhood 12 minutes from the noisy center. very friendly and helpful staff. I felt like at my home.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PLAIN BAD”
Reviews.Author: Patchbj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late september, after reading reviews on here we thought let's give it a go boy were we wrong, if racism, bad service and rats are your thing then by all means give this place a go, upon out arrival we were greeted to swastikas opposite the hotel and red warning tape (ala police like) covering the entire sidewalk of muse, our first night of dinner was a joke, rats ran above us ants were all over our tables no one staff wise batted an eyelid so it is a constant, worst of all we had to wait 38 minutes to get our bill whilst the head of resteraunt chatted to the locals forgetting 4 tables of people in the process, rooms are dated but passable, the lift is a claustrophobians worst nightmare, please take into consideration location on your choice of Rome as this is a good 30 min bus ride from anything of note , get off at termini for all switches, stick to the tourist areas and you'll have a really nice time, unfortuanaetly muse is well north of anything of interest and is a rather intimidating neighbourhood, Lots of young people waiting on street corners, eyeing up valuables on more than a few occasions with myself, I wouldn't suggest walking around at night, the natives are fairly rude, the wont get up for pregnant woman nor elderly people on the bus, a big shock to londoners, and as for the traffic, well what can you say, what a mess, disgusting ethics of non caring macho bull, please watch every single road you cross with caution, big let down and very disappointed in trip advisor reviewers for not mentioning the swastikas, rudeness and rats , think twice about coming to this greif hole

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Reasonably-Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTN70
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Hotel Delle Muse. It is a small, comfortable, spotlessly clean and well-run hotel with very reasonable prices. It is located in an attractive and quiet residential neighborhood away from the noise and traffic of central Rome. Our room was simple and of modest size, but the bathroom was surprisingly spacious. There is a single, very small elevator that has enough room for only one person and suitcase at a time. The 360 bus between the hotel and the Termini station was very convenient. While the bus runs frequently and the ride to Termini station generally was a quick 20 minutes, be aware that there are often long delays in the buses and the ride back to the hotel from the station in the afternoon due to heavy Rome traffic. The buffet breakfast was quite good, with plenty of variety from which to choose and the hotel restaurant serves a very nice fixed-price meal for 18 euros. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. The hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport for a ride that cost 50 euros, almost the same as the cost of a taxi. After a long plane flight, it was great to have a driver meet you and take you to the hotel without having to worry about finding a taxi or other means of transportation. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: earlebee
Reviews.Content: We really liked Delle Muse and would stay again. We did take a taxi from Fuimicino but it isn't necessary. Take the the 360 bus towards Le Muse there are two stops within a short walk from the hotel. Valentina checked us in an she was sooo friendly and helpful. After a short nap and much needed shower, we decided to have a quick lunch at the hotel. It was lovely to sit in the quiet garden and eat food like my Italian grandmother would make. Italian comfort food. Rome is a big place with alot of wonderful restaurants so we only ate there once. The room was clean and large; we had a small single bed in addtion to the queen size bed. It would great for a small family. The bathroom small and shower was really small...but it is a city so I don't expect big facilities. Breakfast was tasty and lovely. Remember, no one does breakfast like Americans so don't expect it. But do have some cafe latte and a roll with cheese and meat. The free internet at the three computers in lobby are very convenient. The front desk staff was helpful and mostly friendly. We got horribly lost coming from the Aqua Acetosa train station and wandered the neighborhood in the dark for an hour. This illustrates two things; 1. stick with the bus and 2. it is a safe neighborhood. We walked to Piazza Ungheria for dinner. Try the very Italian and delish neighborhood cafe that is right there. They have sidewalk seating and interior seating. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Drab hotel in Swastika town”
Reviews.Author: Lemonlux
Reviews.Content: When we got off the bus we were very shocked to see the main street looking like a riot had happened the night before. Red tape was connecting every lamp post and whole Walls were covered in graffiti depicting racist writing and swastikas. Entering the hotel didn't perk our spirits up much either. There we were greeted by a cold, non caring staff member. He didn't so much as smile and after reading all the wonderful reviews of amazingly friendly staff we were disappointed. The lift is hilariously tiny and it was good we didn't have large luggage with us. Our room was alright. It was clean and to average standards however I hated the shower. It's power is very weak and you can't remove it off the wall so your hair gets partially wet each time you shower. The restaurant staff are friendly, better than reception. But one night after dinner we waited nearly 30 mins for our bill. This was because the waiter was chatting to other customers and ignored 3 tables who were all waiting for their bills too. In the end we had to ask if we could charge the meal to our room cause we got so tired waiting for him to finish his conversation. The bus stop is very close to the hotel and buses are regular most of the time. However one day we did wait around 45mins. And when the bus did finally arrive the driver stood outside smoking for about 10mins while passengers waited in a hot sweaty environment. The little town the hotel was located in left much to be Desired. There were not enough restaurants, shops or cafes to warrant staying there. And nearly every wall is riddled with swastikas. This made it a very intimidating place to walk around when the sun set so we were forced to stay in the hotel every evening. At the moment there is some construction work being done. So the main street is very noisy and dirty. Overall I wouldn't recommend staying at the hotel delle muse. It's too far away from the city attractions and the town hasnt got much to offer for entertainment.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ka T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outside the center of Rome so it will take you to get to the center about 30min on the bust, however bus runs every 10-15min. The hotel is nice, clean, staff are friendly, breakfast is good and it has beautiful garden where you can eat. The rooms are a little to small but have needed accommodations, and its not so noisy like i would imagine center of Rome hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: CDLE
Reviews.Content: Please remember that all the following comments are in the context of a modestly priced 3-star hotel. My room was clean, comfortable and reasonably spacious. Wardrobe space was more than adequate but there was almost no drawer space available. Meals, including breakfast, may be taken indoors or alternatively in an attractive, quiet 'garden' area at the rear of the hotel. Breakfasts are very good offering a wide range of hot and cold food. The dinner menu is also extensive and whilst it is certainly not haute cuisine it is exceptionally good value for money. We selected the hotel because it is in a quiet suburb where you can sleep with the window open and not be disturbed. The 360 bus stop is 1 minute away from the hotel, runs every 15 minutes or so and takes 20 minutes to reach Termini where you can connect with the metro, trains and most trams and buses. Alternatively, judicious use of the 360 intermediate stops (and stops beyond Termini) can offer a suprisingly short walk to many worthwhile destinations. All hotel staff are most helpful in a range of situations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, a little outside the hustle and bustle of central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mali_Urke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel only one night on our trip to Italy, since we were in Rome for one day. The hotel was easy to find, a little north of the central Rome, but close to bus stations, several nice restaurants and not much else really. The staff was nice and pleasant and helpful, although it would have helped to know you cannot buy a bus ticket on the bus (paid a 100 Euro fine for the two of us). The rooms were your average European rooms for hotels of 3 stars, not too big, but clean and containing everything that we needed. The breakfast was excellent and the staff serving it was very attentive and cheerful. We felt this was a good value in Rome for sure, unless you want to pay to be downtown, which is also not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “better than 3* hotel with excellent garden-restaurant”
Reviews.Author: theos10
Reviews.Content: Outstanding buffet-breakfast and excellent restaurant compensate the fact that this hotel is a bit off-center. Quiet neighbourhood but DIRECT BUS LINE # 360 TO TERMINI Very helpful multi-lingual staff

Reviews.Title: “Good walking”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui T
Reviews.Content: This is a good small hotel a little north of the city centre. The staff are very helpful and friendly, speak italian, English and German - probably others too but I did not hear them. The room was small but comfortable, although I would have preferred more or plumper pillows but I still slept well anyway. If you are claustrophobic beware the lift! It is like travelling in a shoe box. I usually avoided it but on a couple of occasions was so exhausted from our days exploration I did use it! The food is good, an excellent buffet spread at breakfast. Evening meals are lovely taken out in the garden, but beware of mosquitoes! I ended a couple of evenings with huge bites! Despite the good transport links we walked to and from the city centre - (well there was a transport strike one day!) and discovered the wonderful Villa Borghese park, so we walked more. It is a good hotel, well positioned, good transport. Well worth a return visit

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for travelers on a budget1”
Reviews.Author: jackie56003
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Off the usual path, but the 360 bus makes two stops about a block on each side of the hotel. This is very convenient. Also, the 19 tram stops about 3 blocks away- and this goes directly to the Vatican. All in all, the staff were always very helpful and friendly. The only thing we were disappointed in was the hotel restaurant. Dinner there was the worst we had in all of Italy! But the breakfast was plentiful and great every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Thanos P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after having read the reviews. Our room was ready and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. I would stay here again though as the location was good, away from the rush.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, spacious rooms, helpful staff and great food.”
Reviews.Author: Ron R
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very safe, but somewhat far from the attractions and dining (other than the in-house cafe). The hotel itself is clean, with unexpectedly spacious rooms. Ours had a large accessible balcony overlooking the cafe below. The food for breakfasts and dinners was delicious with great selection and good prices. The staff were very helpful, polite and multi-lingual. The lobby had complimentary internet access. The room's AC wasn't fully functioning and the lift was quite small (which isn't all that unusual), but that was the extent of any problems we had in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: patraulea100
Reviews.Content: Hello, a few days ago we returned from Rome where we stayed at Delle Muse. We have to say that this hotel was a fantastic choice, we were very pleased with the hotel staff and with all the services they provided; the room was very clean and quite a big, towels were daily changed. The breakfast was rich and tasty: pastry, fruit, vegetables, scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants, cheese, tea, coffee, etc. The hotel is at the end of the bus line 360, in Piazza delle Muse. This bus takes you to Termini station in about 15 minutes and from Termini you have connections to all the important points of Rome. Just a 10 minutes` walk from the hotel, between Romania and Ungheria stations of the 360 bus, there is a well supplied supermarket. All in all, Delle Muse offers a good quality price ratio, which makes us say for sure that when we come back in Rome (we hope the coins we threw in Fontana di Trevi will help us come back there:) we will certainly choose one more time to check in at this hotel. Mille grazie, Delle Muse!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Xontheweb
Reviews.Content: Bear in mind that I am very fussy: very good location, excellent support from all the staff, great breakfast with very large choice and plenty to eat,. I don't know about the other rooms, but ours had a great terrace with table and chairs with lots of green all around (1st floor), very clean and very spacious room, perfect bathroom, very efficient air coonditionning. Rome is hot and it was great to have marble floors. 1 large double bed and 2 single beds were plenty. The only hic was the internet which was experiencing an August Italian breakdown. The hotel looked old but was charming and well kept. We could park fr free just next to the hotel in this residential area where it felt very safe, it was nice and was 10 mins walk from town, tram, bus, shops, etc. I hope you buy your island, Boss! I have started saving myself!!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: adiglobal
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel is out of the center is a blessing as it enables you to relax away from the hub-bub of Rome itself. A 20 minute bus ride which stops a few meters up the road will take you to Termini which is the major transport hub for Rome. A weekly ticket for 16 Euro means you can hop on and off at will. The staff speak pretty good English and were tolerant of our inability to speak Italian. Our room was very good with air-con and an excellent five piece bathroom. The mattress was a bit firm for my liking but apart from that, the only things missing were tea making facilities and a fridge to keep drinks cool. The inclusive buffet breakfast was better than most other hotels I have stayed at and catered for every pallet. A really good start to the day. Dinner was taken alfresco in the lovely covered garden with a menu that was not over expensive. All in all a good family run hotel which cost less than half what I would have had to pay in Rome central.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa M
Reviews.Content: This hotel lies in a calm area with very good connections to the city. No problem finding parking space for your car, very cheap. The hotel has a restaurant with very tasty food. The people working in the hotel is always glad and happy to help you with what so ever. If you want to be satisfied with your staying in Roma, pick this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Europe_July_2011
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in Rome after reading all the great reviews. We had a tight budget of $100/night including breakfast so this hotel suited out needs. Leading up to the arrival I had sent an email in relation to transport to the hotel. I was informed the the 360 bus stopped close to the hotel and that all you needed to do was walk back from the stop about 100m. This information was spot on, we found the hotel with no problem. Finding the stop for the 360 at the other end was a little trickier especially when we had been on a plane for 18 hours, but all worked out. Breakfast was lovely with HOT and COLD options. We were going to dine out one night but didn't want to go to far from the hotel so chose to eat at the hotel. Thinking that it was going to be expensive 'like all hotel restaurants' we were pleasantly surprised with the price and would recommend to anyone, prices are cheap, food was great and service was amazing :) A must stay for any budget traveler or family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitteecatz
Reviews.Content: I went with my friend for the first time in May 2011 to Rome, we booked with Jet2 Holidays and before finally making the booking,we checked on Tripadvisor. After arriving in the centre of Rome, we knew we had to get the 360 bus, only 1 euro for the ticket, buy in advance at tabacs or booths near Termini Station. Now, make sure the 360 bus definitely has ''MUSE'' on the front, othrwise you'll get a mini tour before arriving at the hotel. We finally arrived at the hotel and we were quickly checked in, we went in an extremely small lift, max 3 people or two depending on size. Our room was at the back of the hotel, the room was quite simply furnished, we got the safe free of charge, the bathroom had a decent shower but again very simple in style. We found the beds comfy, nice and clean linen, I did have to get an extra pillow. Also, nice and quiet, the benefit of being out of the city centre. One thing we liked was the breakfast, hot and cold menu, we found it set us up, there was the usual cold type food, 2-3 cheeses to choose from, hams, salami, fruit in juice, also fresh fruit like kiwi fruits, bananas, oranges. The main hot food was scrambled eggs, you could also boil your own eggs; sausages and bacon, toast. Also cakes on offer,croissants and the usual crusty bread. There was juices, one was a Red Orange, more a cordial but nice, and I always had coffee with hot milk, there was various teas available, so a really good choice. We did eat in at the hotel and it was about 7 Euro's for a pasta type meal, one waiter Ali was really nice and always so friendly, oh with the meal you got a glass of wine included in the price which was a nice touch. There are a few shops in the area, and we found 2 decent supermarkets, one was quite big, sort of hidden up! But explore the area, turn left out of the hotel walk a few minutes and they seem to be on the 'right' hand side walking down. Finally, the staff were lovely and helpful, this isn't a pretentious hotel, but we loved it and would definitely return, there is also free use of computers and I think printing in the reception area. If you don't mind being a couple of miles outside of Rome Centre, well priced, I really do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: ruchir13
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff...... little far from city center but ample amount of connectivity...... rooms are cozy and room service is excellent.... I must say that this is the best place for budget travelers.............

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a great vacation on a budget”
Reviews.Author: KasiKaczka
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Hotel Delle Muse. It was our first time visiting Rome and we had no clue about anything. We were somewhat worried that the hotel's location would be an inconvenience but it is not as far from the center as we thought. There's a bus (360) within 100 meters from it which goes into the city center and connects a few stops out to the 63 bus which runs to many touristy areas. Besides, a cab ride to Termini or Piazza Navona is less than 15 euro. The breakfast is a buffet with a large selection of foods and drinks and is just delicious. All the servers are super friendly and helpful. The room is big enough; we had one with a balcony and when opening the doors in the morning we were able to look out on what seemed like paradise. There is an elevator in the building, 3 computers for patrons' use, air conditioning, tv with cable, and a safe that will fit an iPad and dslr camera comfortably. The garden where the lunch and dinner is served is beautiful, covered with lush greens which keep the temperature down in midday and is aesthetically pleasing. A half block down the street are small shops and bakeries with pizza, sandwiches, drinks, and the like. The prices there are nothing compared to those nearer Rome's center. Overall our hotel stay was very satisfactory - we recommend it to our friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Especially Paulo and Ali”
Reviews.Author: kellrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delle Muse for a week in June 2011. Had a very comfortable room, clean, neat and fresh linens daily. The staff was good at the front desk; answered questions, spoke English and polite. The restaurant was excellent. Waiters Paulo and Ali were superb!! Very nice guys with humorous streak. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Father_Fred
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week & the hotel ticked all the boxes. The staff were all very friendly, helpful & accommodating. The en suite room was cleaned & changed (fresh linen & towels) every day. The buffet breakfast would keep us going well into the late afternoon. Although the breakfast time finished at 10am, you weren't hurried out if you'd were still enjoying a coffee or finishing off your toast at 20 past. The restaurant had a reasonably priced menu & the food was great on the whole. The mixed salad is definitely better than the buffet table veg option though imo. The hotel is situated to the north of the city but we enjoyed the (exit hotel & turn left) 15 minute stroll down to the bus/trolley stop (19 to Vatican or 3 to Colosseum) You can use these buses to connect to the metro system. There is also an underground station 15 minutes the other way (exit hotel & turn right) but its a bit of a mission to find & I'd only recommend it if the buses went on strike tbh. I feel the staff make any hotel what it is & I can honestly say the staff at the Delle Muse were a credit to the hotel profession. A1+ from me

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SherryHays
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days with our grand children and we had a wonderful time. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff could not do enough to make it perfect and worked with us to accomodate some special requests. They also provided some great advise about where to visit and how to manage the transportation around Rome. We ended up eating at the restaurant alot, it was excellent. My grandson highly recommends the pasta carbonara! Breakfast was amazing. This hotel is near easy transportation but the neighborhood is quiet - a great relief after a long day of touring!!! Thanks Gorgio and all the rest of you, our stay was great. The Hays Family

Reviews.Title: “A litte gem”
Reviews.Author: Sue104
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We chose it because it was out of the city with its inherent noise. It is situate in an upper class residential area and it was quiet, we were able to sleep undisturbed. Our room was on the small side but it was adequate and, let's face it, we only slept in it. It was clean, the air conditioning was a boon and came at no extra charge as did the in room safe. The staff were incredibly friendly and some of the most helpful we have ever encountered. They spoke perfect English and were always available to help and advise. The outdoor restaurant was a tranquil haven after a busy day sightseeing. The bus (360) stopped virtually outside the hotel and was regular and no hassle at all to use, as was all public transport. We bought a 3 day ticket for 11€ each and it was a godsend and would recommend you buy either a 3 day or 7 day depending on the length of your stay. All in all we couldn't fault the hotel or its staff, we slept well, were cool in the Rome heat and in answer to the question would we stay there again, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, friendly and affordable hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fernan35
Reviews.Content: This friendly and quiet hotel is in Rome's Parioli district, out of the noise, hustle and bustle of downtown Rome but a short cab ride to the Spanish steps. The hotel is a five minute walk away from Piazza Ungheria where you can connect to bus lines or have a relaxed dinner at one of several very good restaurants and pizzerias. From there it is a very short walk to Villa Borghese. The walk might not be for everyone, but we have twice walked from the hotel to the the historic center (e.g. to the Pantheon). Signore Giorgio Lazar is an excellent manager and owner. After we left he continued to help us track the luggage our airline lost, even though we were no longer his guests. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and affordable. Breakfast in the garden is very pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “as good as we were told it would be”
Reviews.Author: ahare123
Reviews.Content: We checked out this hotel on Trip advisor prior to booking, it had lots of very good reviews and we weern't dissapointed. Clean and comfortabe hotel, friendly staff who are courteus and very helpful. Food is fabulous and good value at 18euro for three courses, wine priced competitively too. Local bus runs regurlarly from near the hotel to the Terminus ( 20 minutes duration) for all metro or other bus links. Nice to get away from the bustle of the city centre to relax on an evening. We would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MnMFunTimes
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location and setting in the middle of the hustle & bustle of Rome city! Rooms are spacious and clean and the back patio/garden is like a mini Oasis in the middle of the city. A short distance (by bus) away from the main city center but very accessible by public transport of cab. We picked this one based on recommendation on www.frommers.com. We stayed there for two nights after our cruise trip. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the maid there is especially sweet :) The restaurant is pretty good and its a good option to have if you dont want to always venture out for all meals. Breakfast is served in a dining room and there are a lot of options to choose from. All in all would definately recommend if you are looking for spacious clean accommodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended! Awesome Staff! Awesome Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: urbnflower84
Reviews.Content: I went to Hotel Delle Muse with some friends for vacation in May 2011. This was an awesome place. When we arrived the staff was really friendly and really helpful. They gave us maps and traveling tips. I had a single room. It wasn't huge but it was a nice size with a queen sized bed, flat screened TV and safe to keep my personals. I feel like you need a little more space you may want to go with a double. It was immaculately clean which is very important to me. The best part of my stay actually started as the worst. I left my favorite sweater. Gasp! I emailed the staff and they responded immediately. I received my sweater in about a week and all I paid was the shipping which was about 8 euros. If I make it back to Rome I will definitely stay here. My only wish is that it was closer to the city but there is a bus stop close that will take you where you need to go for about a euro. Don't forget breakfast there was a large spread from fruit, pastries and cereal. So make sure you get up early to make it!

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about Rome”
Reviews.Author: ShaunD103
Reviews.Content: What a breath of fresh air Delle Muse was! Myself and fiancee stepped off a plane and underwent a terrible journey on our way to the hotel. It wasn't the best start to our holiday. However we arrived at Delle Muse and were greeted by nothing but friendly staff. We got checked in and the guy at the desk gave us everything we needed from maps to water. We got to our room which was a little small but very clean and comfortable! One thing that really stood out about Delle Muse is the restaurant. Not only is the service amongst the best Ive ever had but the food was simply out of this world. In the end myself and fiancee didn't eat anywhere in Rome for our evening meals apart from Delle Muse due to the food being so good. The hotel is well located. There is a bus service that takes you straight into the town centre which is cheap and regular or you can easily make the journey on foot in under 30 minutes (you may get lost first time round!) Breakfast was also good and there is a large selection of food available. I would definitely recommend that if you visit Rome you strongly consider this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, restaurant and staff. We recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: schmusib
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Delle Muse was an outstanding experience for us during our stay in Rome. The staff was most accomodating, the room spotless, the service excellent. We also very much enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. The restaurant was excellent. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fmkrivicich
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a pleasure, a hidden treasure of Rome. Reasonably priced, our room was very nice, large, CLEAN, with a great terrace off of our room where we could relax. Even better than that, the hotel staff was absolutely lovely, everyone was so incredibly helpful and did their best to go out of their way to accomodate any and all of our needs. Not necessarily in the center of Rome, but no more than a 10 minute cab ride to the center of the action- we didn't find it a problem at all...I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The great reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: travelinfam25
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys, ages 6 and 9, stayed here May 18-22 and we loved it. I'd read from the reviews that it was outside the city center, and had decided to use cabs to get to the sights (my wife and kids get sick on buses). With that in mind, the location was great. It's a nice, quiet, more upscale area, the perfect place to relax after a day spent amid the bustle and crazed drivers of Rome. Cab fares were not too much, about 10-15 euro to the major sights. We had a very nice, clean quad room on the first floor, a large bed for my wife and I and two little beds, side by side, in an offset area for the kids. The beds weren't very soft- we didn't find any in Italy that were- but we used the extra blankets provided to pad it. My only other mild critique of the room would be that the shower temperature never got above warm (I love hot showers). But that said, we would certainly stay here again, it was great. The staff was very helpful and friendly, obviously genuinely concerned with our stay. My wife and sons are Celiac (gluten intolerant), and the hotel gave us a goody bag full of gluten free items for them to eat for breakfast on our arrival. My 6 year old was very excited! Italy is much more aware of gluten intolerance than the US. In fact, all Italians are checked for Celiac disease when they are born, and we ate delicious gluten free food our entire stay and never got contaminated. The hotel restaurant also has gluten free options, including gluten free pasta. Plus, the hotel is literally right across the street from a Pharmacy (Farmacia), which are required to sell gluten free foods by law. For us the Hotel Delle Muse was "buonissimo!"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lois72
Reviews.Content: The desk staff all speak English, were very helpful and friendly. Each day they helped us find the best public transportation for our outing, plotted it on a map, and gave us helpful advice. Most of the restaurant staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff was also very good and helpful. The location is right on a bus line that goes to central Rome in a quiet neighborhood, far from the madding crowds! The included breakfast is wonderful and optional dinners are good and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with an excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: forte22
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse was excellent. I arrived early and the young lady at the front desk helped me to get immediate access to my room. The room was clean, had a safe for my valuables and a spotless bathroom. The on site restaurant provided a bountiful breakfast!the restaurnt also seved lunchand dinner. There was afixed price special every night, The service was good and the food was good too. The 360 bus goes directly to Termini Stationand from there take theA and /or B line anywhere in Rome. I recommend The Hotel Delle Muse and I plan on returning !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitebag
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three night stay at this hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood near Piazza Muse. It is convenient to public transportation and has nearby restaurants and shops to meet your needs. The staff was knowledgeable and went out of their way to be helpful. Valentina was especially helpful. She suggested a wonderful neighborhood Gelateria "Giovanni's", and many wonderful cultural sights to make our trip enjoyable. We were made to feel like family at this facility. This hotel is well worth a stay. I have stayed in other hotels in Rome on other trips, but I rate this as my best experience for that city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in an elegant part of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas50062
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed the very pleasant, green and quiet area the hotel is located in (25 minutes from the city centre by bus). The rooms were comfortable and renovated, the staff very friendly and the breakfast buffet offered quite a lot compared to Italian standard. The in-house restaurant offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay. Very happy with the place.”
Reviews.Author: bakphoenix
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel from the moment I got there. Check-in was done in just a couple of minutes. I can't add a lot to the prior reviews without repeating the same information. I found it was a good value, no unwelcome surprises. The only warning I would give is skip the car service they promote for the airport. It's nearly $100 US to do a one way trip (they quote a price that does not include luggage). We used airportshuttle.it., which took us to the airport for $31 Euro (2 people) and we had to leave at 4AM. Wi Fi and computers in the lobby helped us keep Facebook pictures current! The area is somewhat residential, but tucked away are several pizzerias, and one a couple of blocks away, serves beer and the locals from the area seem to congregate there to socialze. Nice people. There is also a market about 4 blocks down the street where you can buy Italian coffee and wine for under two Euros. They had Italian candy as well. We found great gifts to bring back there at great prices. The area has more to offer than it appears at first glance, as while it is nice, it seems to be mostly residential.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for extended stay traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: stephy1967
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse was a wonderful hotel located in a great section of Parioli. This small town had everything you needed in walking distance shops food etc... The hotel itself was nice and the staff there was wonderful. They helped me with directions and instructions on the best things to do in Rome. It took me some time to get used to the iron roll up gates on the windows and the small compact room but this is customary there in most cases. Overall I enjoyed my stay there and would recommend it for those who would rather stay outside of the city of Rome Center. It took about 20 minutes on the 360 bus and 20 minutes in another direction on the 19 trolley to get to some of the major sites. but the bus ride itself was so exciting with the local people traveling back and forth to work.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Home”
Reviews.Author: dogfood1951
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Delle Muse. The staff were extremely warm and friendly from the hotel manager, Georgio, the head waiter, Poalo to the maid service staff. Everyone went out of their way to make us comfortable and welcomed. The hotel is quaint and very clean. The beds were comfortable and we slept like babies. The hotel has a bar and restuarant and we ended up eating our evening meal there every night as the food was delicious and inexpensive. Breakfast was included with our stay and it had an array of options to choose from. You could boil your own eggs or choose the scrambled eggs. They provided bacon, sausage, sweet rolls, croissants, breads, rolls, meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, juices, milk or a choice of coffee, cafe au lait or tea. All in all, we could not have asked for better service, attention and quality at an affordable price. I would recommend this hotel to a first time traveler to Rome, or any traveler for that matter. It is outside the madness of the tourist section of Rome, but easily accessible ( 15 minutes) by the 360 bus. Thank you Hotel Muse Staff for a great time. Jill and Mick from Minnesota.

Reviews.Title: “CHarming hotel. Super staff.”
Reviews.Author: StevenFors
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service for a moderately priced hotel. Reception staff could not have been better. Helpful, informative, always eager to please. Location is a bit off the beaten track, but the neighborhood is beautiful and a bus line passes right in front of the hotel. Breakfast is terrific. restaurant excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Great little getaway”
Reviews.Author: WelshBoy1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we visited Rome towards the end of March 2011 and found it to be a great experience, the hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful with all of our needs. It is out of town but after walking miles each day we were happy to step away from it all and the hotel location allowed us to do that, the number 360 bus goes by the hotel every 15 minutes or so which will take you into the city centre as will a short walk take you to the number 19 tram that will take you over to Vatican City. We stayed in the hotel to eat every evening and the food was really good and not overpriced, a bottle of chianti was €9 and the main courses were €7 with potatoes and vegetables being extra, their beef in green pepper sauce was gorgeous and the 2 waiting staff were both entertaining and charming. One last thing to mention was the hotel lift, if my shoulders were another 3 inches wider then I wouldn't be able to fit in their sideways! We had a good laugh about it which just added to the experience and I'd happily recommend this hotel to anyone going.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with everything you need - with great people!”
Reviews.Author: Dimacawa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse was a very nice hotel with all comfort you can expect. The people working there are very friendly and helpful. It is outside the main center area, however within 30 minutes walk you were already close to the center and the busses were driving very frequently! Also the hotel had a nice restaurant where you can taste the Italian delicacies :)

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel with a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: owennickkath
Reviews.Content: In a quiet residential area near a bus stop. Friendly Hotel with a good value restaurant. We were a party of 4 and enjoyed our trip. The Hotel was well patronised and we will certainly return when next going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: curtinj
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived; we were not sure what to expect from this out of the way hotel which seemed to cater to more of a business clientele as it doesn't have all of the bells and whistles of a resort hotel. We found the staff to be extraordinarily attentive and willing to take that extra step for their guests.. We found our room quite comfortable with a very comfortable bed and above all, nice and quiet. The perfect place to get a good nights sleep after a long day of sight seeing. The food offerings were a bit better than expected for a hotel of this caliber, but I believe the staff goes the extra mile to ensure that their guests are happy with the food and service. We will definitely stay there again when we get back to Rome one of these days; preferably in the Spring/Summer time when the rear garden/patio area is in full bloom to take advantage of that ambience that the hotel has to offer, so perhaps our only disappointment was traveling at the wrong time of year to this hotel. Quite frankly, I don't think we would have enjoyed staying in the heart of the City, as you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of the City, and the Hotel Delle Muse offers what you need. James & Cheryl Curtin Walpole, MA USA

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly,clean & excellent value”
Reviews.Author: dfbull
Reviews.Content: In a quiet,residential area but easy to get to all Rome attractions using cheap local bus to connect with centre where you can walk to/take metro to areas you wish to visit. Very handy (20 min walk) to Stadio Flaminio for Rugby enthusiasts. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are of adequate size and very clean.Hotel restaurant offers good quality food from extensive menu and is extremely good value. We decided to take all our meals at hotel after dining there the first night ! Cannot speak too highly and would not hesitate to recommend to family & friends David Bull.Leicester,England

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much we stayed again, already!”
Reviews.Author: hickmangirl
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in room 250--awesome room with really nice balcony overlooking the courtyard...no street noise--for a 4 days. It isn't the biggest room in the world but was fine with us considering we left every morning around 10 and only returned around 7 or 8 that night. Only one English tv channel, Fox News...but at least you'll have an idea of what's going on in the States. There is free wi-fi, just get the password at reception. Also, these guys are great because they let us check-in early on our return visit, and there wasn't any hassle--we actually left our luggage and then walked down to Saturno to get some awesome food (hotel restaurant wasn't open yet). Another huge thing is that Claudio ( I think that's his name) speaks Italian, English, German, and French and everyone else seems pretty multi-lingual as well--if you're worried about not being understood don't even worry it! On our return we were put in room 121 which was HUGE with a huge patio...definitely a room for in the spring when everything is blooming! It was really nice but the shower was smaller than in 250 but still big enough for me. The restaurant is fine for food if you aren't planning on going out that day but, there's better cuisine in Rome proper. We did eat quite a few meals there and all of it was decent, good quality food but when you're in Rome you should eat somewhere besides your hotel! There is an absolutely lovely little pizzeria/tratteria called Saturno straight down from the hotel...right next to the grocery store. The guys inside speak a little English and understand hand gestures and broken simple Italian...I think they found it amusing when we came in and ordered stuff. Absolutely wonderful chicken salad filled focaccia!! Turn left out of the hotel and continue walking straight down the street, it's the orange modern looking storefront on the right hand side corner after the Carabinieri with automatic sliding doors, grocery store is on the righthand side of it. Trust me, all of their food is amazing and pretty cheap. Location of hotel. While not in the thick of things, it isn't out in the middle of nowhere with no good transportation links. A taxi from the termini station will cost you 13 euro, which is reasonable and my recommended mode of getting there if you have any luggage whatsoever. Then, once at the hotel, you can buy a Roma pass off the front desk which includes 3 days of unlimited transit usage...so you can immediately hop on bus 360. The stop is a short walk uphill from the hotel--turn right out the front doors and walk to the top of the hill where they are doing construction, the bus stop will be on your right and is clearly signposted with times. I don't think you should have to fear about safety because you're a short distance from the Carabinieri, and I know there are a few of those officers that eat in the restaurant. Also, it is a more residential neighborhood with people out and about at most hours of the day so you're less likely to encounter trouble--unless you forget to look down and step in dog poo! My mom and I (65 and 32) didn't feel the least bit worried about anything untoward happening to us and we felt comfortable enough to leave the patio doors open at night, if needed. This may not be the fanciest hotel but, if you're looking for quiet, laid-back, and unpretentious this is definitely the place. We stayed there for 4 days and then returned for a 2 night stay after our cruise so you can tell we're big fans.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Delle Muse is to me Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth33Tucson_
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse with the wonderful Owner/Management who take great care of their customers is like coming home after a full day of sight seeing or travelling around this part of Italy. The Breakfeast-Buffett is a real fine start into an adventurous day ! I (and my son) have been there a few times and we would not go anywhere else ! The Hotel is not close to the center,but the bus is an absolutely direct connection to the City and all the important places (including Stazione Termini).

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: JosC256
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel delle Muse very much. The staff went out of their way to be friendly, accommodating and helpful. The staff spoke excellent English and the restaurant was better than average. The buffet breakfast, in particular was excellent catering to all tastes. The desk clerks were especially helpful in suggesting local restaurants and securing taxis in the evening. Although the rooms were very small, they were clean and had all of the amenities. The hotel was outside the center of the city, but attractions could be easily reached by a near-by bus stop. Recommend buying the weekly bus pass which also can be used for the subways.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: RedDragonDaniel
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure all the hotel staff were happy, very helpful and genuinely seemed pleased and interested in making my stay as enjoyable as possible. The room was pleasantly warm, clean and the bed comfortable. The same applies to the bathroom facilities. The free internet was a bonus and had reasonably consistent speeds. Breakfast was in buffet format, well presented and delicious. The evening meals were also very delicious and not ridiculously expensive. The only negative thing was the location which to be fair isn't really a big deal. If you intend to use this hotel as a base to spend a lot of time touring around Rome you will need to walk for 30-35 minutes to get to the nearest Metro. If you don't want to walk there is a bus and tram service on the main road about 10 minutes away. I personally liked the location in general as it was in a pleasant, quiet road away from the traffic and noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I look forward to staying here the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: socarolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I signed up for a 6 day "thanksgiving in Rome" deal with Go-Today travel, and this hotel was one of those included. (To people planning to use the $25 Go-Today shuttle service from the airport: it took almost an hour to stand in line to check in and then wait for it, and then literally 2 hours of an uncomfortable jolting and jerking van ride, with a cold wind blowing on me from the continually-coughing-driver's open window, to reach the hotel. Consider using the train from the airport and a taxi or bus to the hotel instead.) I checked Delle Muse out with tripadvisor and liked what I read. I have to agree with those positive reviews. We liked it for these reasons: -We got there about 11 AM and were allowed to check into the room 3 hours early. -Quiet, safe, residential area, lots of trees, almost no traffic noise heard in the room. However, we could hear the people in the room next to ours using the bathroom and talking. Fortunately they were mostly quiet or gone. -Excellent staff. All the desk staff spoke English, and the restaurant wait staff understood it well enough not to be a problem. Especially outstanding were Gavriel (desk) and Paolo (waiter). Everyone was eager to please. When we needed phone calls made locally (e.g., to set up a reservation to tour the Borghese Gallery), they were willing to do it for us. -Our room was very clean, spacious, attractive, and comfortable. I know some people have complained about the beds being hard, but they were fine with us. We asked for twin beds. It was actually almost like a king size bed but with separate linens, and a space of a couple fo inches between. The room style is older, which we liked. Furniture was a teeny bit worn, but not ugly, and everything worked. The weather was chilly while we were there but the room was a very comfortable temperature. The room safe and room internet worked well.
