The TV had lots of interesting channels (though I hate to think of non-Americans seeing Fox News as representative of America!) and worked well. -Bathroom was large and equipped with everything (except shampoo), including a real shower stall with a door, unlike many European bathrooms that let the water go all over the place. -Linens and all supplies were plentiful, replaced as needed, and were spotless. -Our only problem with the room was there was no sort of chest of drawers, so clothes had to be stacked in the wardrobe shelves, and there was very poor light into it, unless it was daylight and the drapes were open. -The breakfast is marvelous and has even more items than I see listed in the reviews. We never needed to eat again until evening, it was so plentiful. -The dinner is another matter. As it was moderately priced and convenient, we ate three dinners there and the total was about 130 Euros. However, the quality was very uneven. We did better eating elsewhere. Our favorite was a place a block from the Pantheon called Rotunda Ristorante (or Cafe) where we got a really good and large three course meal in a nice atmosphere, for less than 10 Euros each. I recommend their fixed price meal of lasagna and roast beef. -The only other negative is transportation. The bus is nearby, and comes every 10 minutes M-F, less often on Sat. and 30 min. on Sunday (the person who said in their review it is supposed to come every 10 minutes on Sunday didn't read the weekend schedule on the other side of the pole). However, on this Sunday they simply skipped one arrival, so we waited an hour. It goes to the terminal, where you can catch some other buses and the metro, but it takes the bus 30 minutes to get there. A taxi to termini takes about 10 minutes and costs 13 euros. However, if you are going to get a quiet, moderately priced residential neighborhood hotel like this, the trade-off is that it is less close to things in the city's center. All in all, if we go to Rome again and stay at a hotel, we will certainly stay here. Otherwise, we will do as we've done before and rent an apt. more conveniently located. You can find nice ones for less than the average moderate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest people!”
Reviews.Author: AlyceM
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time I've stayed at this hotel. I like it because it's located away from the tourist frenzy, in a safe upscale neighborhood. The bus stops a block away so getting around is easy. Claudio and Giorgio go out of their way to make things easy for you, which is particularly appreciated if you don't know Rome well, and don't speak Italian. They had a great buffet breakfast, and Paolo makes it a pleasure to dine in or have drinks at the bar. For more than one, it's quite economical for them to arrange a €49 pickup at the airport rather than try to handle luggage on the train and bus. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant relief from the Hectic City”
Reviews.Author: ajojo
Reviews.Content: After two and a half weeks in Italy and still going up to Venice we stopped in Rome for two nights. What a wonderful relief to have gracious host and accommodating staff. Nino amongst others was a pleasure to deal with, nothing was too much trouble though he was very busy. The rooms were comfortable , water was hot and Breakfast were way above average with all you could possible desire. The location was a good one to catch a bus to Centro Rome and all the sights. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone that is tired and needs a good rest while still wanting to Roma... Joe & Joe USA

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wagz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from September 23 to 30, 2010. We knew it was a bit of a distance from downtown but the hotel gave us an information package that told us how to use the bus that was 2 blocks away. They also told us about a 7day transit pass that cost 16 euro and was valid for buses, trams and the metro. The concierge were very helpful and spoke multiple languages. The rooms were a bit small, especially the beds and shower but the amazing service and cleanliness made up for it. The included breakfast was fantastic! We had choices of eggs, bacon, sausage, cheeses, cold meats, cereal, fruit, yogurt, a variety of pastries, coffee, tea and juices. The hotel also provided 3 computers in the lobby with complimentary internet. The area was quiet and safe, as we walked around even after dark. The hotel is one bus ride away from the Termini (downtown) and one tram ride from the Vatican. They had a restaurant that was available with good prices and diverse menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice in a sweet part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: amillionsteps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for one week in Rome. The front desk people we helpful and one always made us laugh. The food in the restaurant was delicious. The servers were great and nice to deal with. The hotel room was nice with a balcony to look our from. There was a bedet in our washroom which was a fun thing to try. The room was always made up nicely by the maids. I really have nothing to complain about. The only thing would be that if you want to be walking distance from the colloseum this is not for you. But otherwise you hop on a bus and are there in the city centre. Being Rome it's not far to get somewhere by a little metro or bus ride. So the location didn't bother us. Thanks for a very nice home away from home Delle Muse :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: JoeyRainbow
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in mid September. It's a nice hotel. Great service and good breakfast buffet. The room was clean and spacious with a nice patio. Only a 2 of minute walk from the bus stop. It's a 30 minute ride to the train station. The wait for the bus each day was at least half hour and on Sunday over one hour (even though the bus schedule posted said every 10 minutes). To much time was wasted waiting for a bus! I would definitely seek a closer location to city center next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel but garden needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: issy20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with friends in september 2010. Found the reception staff to be very friendly a lot of information was given to us on arrival, tips on staying safe in Rome helpfull information about buses and trains. The breakfast was good lots to choose from, the bedrooms were clean and the beds were comfy. We never ate in the restaurant so cant comment on this. The hotel itself is a good bit from the centre but the 360 bus which stops just along from hotel takes you into the centre, a taxi can cost as much as 20euros. The hotel's beer garden was quite neglected stuck in a bit of a time warp which is a shame it could do with a bit of imagination and attention as it would be a nice spot to sit and rest weary legs and enjoy a drink after walking around Rome all day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine but stay away from their "restaurant"”
Reviews.Author: AnExpediaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August/2010 following the several good reviews we read here. We were pleased with the hotel in general; the rooms were fine, the staff at the reception was kind and the breakfast was very good considering the hotel category and price. As it was mentioned by some reviewers, the hotel also has a nice garden with a restaurant. We decided to have our last dinner in this restaurant, just one night before our departure. Well, I must say that I would advise anyone to stay away from it, no matter how attractive the prices might be. After we took a table, it took some 10 minutes for the waiter to bring us a menu, although there were only 4 more tables occupied at that time. Although I had initially thought this was just a poor service, I now realise this might have been some kind of warning, like if it was a subtle way to give us a chance to leave and look for a better place… Anyway, the waiter made up for it by bringing a complimentary glass of champagne which was nice. We noticed that the menu had a warning stating that everything is freshly made and therefore, customers should be patient as the food might take time to be prepared. Although I am not keen on waiting long, I must say that I got confident when I read that the food is freshly made; that actually sounded promising! Our order was not the most difficult to prepare; we choose the “bruschetta with tomato, olive and basil”, “spaghetti aglio and olio” and “risotto al funghi”. The last option was taken after the waiter assured it is prepared with porcini mushrooms. We have also taken the house wine to go with it. The first thing that came was the wine, which was better than expected for the price (4€ for half-liter).. everything seemed good till here! The bruschetta came right after it… and the first thing we noticed was that the “olive and basil” that were mentioned in the menu were missing and we were left with a piece of toast with chopped tomatoes which was rather bland. This was however not so bad compared with the spaghetti aglio olio. I have no idea on what their recipe is but it consisted of some watery pasta with tasteless pieces of garlic and frozen leaves of some herb that I ask myself if it was Parley (it was as tasteless as the garlic and therefore difficult to identify). If it is to serve something like that they should just give the customers a package of “Cup Noodles”, I am afraid it would have tasted better. It goes without saying that the “Risotto” was not much greater. It was obviously made with champignons instead of porcini not to mention that the rice was definitely not risotto rice! Oh, did I mention that the menu said it should be “creamy”? Well, it wasn’t at all! Just some plain boiled rice mixed with pieces of champignon.. great risotto! We did not have the guts nor will to try and pay any desert after those dishes. It was obviously our worst meal experience in Italy and quite sad that our trip had to end like that! There are plenty of affordable good restaurants in the city (just read the advices for restaurants in trip advisor) so I would recommend trying something else and to stay away from the hotel restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaNizza
Reviews.Content: large room, kind service, silence, nice quarter, green

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNeptune
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Very nice and friendly stuff, good rooms and even a nice in-expensive and good restaurant inside. The only real problem is the distance from city center - 30+ minutes on bus + an average 15 min waiting time in each direction.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel in Rome close to Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: murraymints3
Reviews.Content: This Hotel although not central is ideal; away from the hustle and bustle of tourists and traffic, nestled amongst lush greenery , close to the famous Villa Borghese. A Local bus service operates very close to the hotel, taking you to the centre. After a day's sightseeing or shopping, you can relax in the peace and tranquility of the garden. All the rooms are very clean and tidy. Staff very courteous and friendly. Free access to the internet via computers in reception and wi-fi throughout. Private hire and airport transfers can be arranged by the hotel staff. I highly recommend this hotel. I've been staying here for a few years now.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: danilo13
Reviews.Content: We were very tired from a long drive from France, and overloaded with luggage and Hotel Le Muse gave us a very good and nice rest. Very friendly staff, starting from Giorgio the Director, who made everything and beyond to make us feel at home in a clean and nice place. The restaurant is in a shadowed garden, which is the best for summer time. In a word: warmly recommended. Daniel

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I stayed in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MarianTravels
Reviews.Content: I am a Sri Lankan tour organizer who take groups to Rome , Fatima and Lourdes since 2004. I first had the problem of finding out a convenient hotel in Rome . Finally, I managed to find Hotel Delle Muse through the internet. My first impression was that the owner is quite prompt in communicating as well as in English. After visiting the hotel in 2007, I came to the conclusion that I have done my best selection. The owner as well as its staff knows how to welcome its guests and make them happy and homely. The hotel is located in a quiet atmosphere, but convenient in all ways, i.e. rooms with all facilities including safety lockers, a very good restaurant with various varieties of food that suit guests from different countries, convenient in public transport etc. etc. I can recommend Hotel Delle Muse in Rome to any person looking for a homely, safe place with all the facilities. Grizil Hettiarachchi

Reviews.Title: “Better Places To Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barking-Dog-Ranch
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after watching it's video on line. Looked real nice. The Hotel is in a residential area about 30-45 minutes by bus and metro from any of the attractions in Rome. The room was average size and the bathroom was larger than most. We got to check in early (about 11 am) the first day, dropped luggage in room and took off to see Rome. When we got back to the hotel we noticed ants marching on both sides of the bedroom and also in the bathroom. We notified the desk clerk and he accused us of eating in the room and attracting the ants. (rather hard since we had only dropped the luggage.) The chamber maid tried spraying (I think it was windex) on the ants moped up what was there and then left. Our whole stay we had ants and we complained daily. The food in the dining room was fair and they had an all inclusive 18 euro meal, but we found that eating elsewhere was a better deal. (There was a small store with sweets, coffee and sandwiches about a block away that we enjoyed much more!) The twin beds were more of a metal frame with a thin pad on top. Definitely the most uncomfortable beds on our vacation. The floor of the room could have definitely used a real good wet mop job. I think the most that was done daily was a quick dry mop and out the door. The balcony was there, but again it was filthy. The AC only worked barely until the last night. A couple of the members of the staff were very nice, the chambermaid tried as did a couple of the desk clerks so all of the help in the hotel did not seem indifferent to our ant problem. And when we did check out, they called us a cab and never once inquired how we liked our stay. Next time we will stay closer to the attractions and definitely in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kabwade
Reviews.Content: Not close to the city center, but easy access by bus.

Reviews.Title: “You feel, not in a Hotel, but visiting friends”
Reviews.Author: ArmandoTravel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were tired, finding our way to delle Muse had not been straight forward. At the front desk we met this couple that had missed their flight and were checking in again, yet they looked happy; without us asking, they commented, you’ll love it here! My wife was not excited about this hotel, to say the least. That same day Giorgio, explained the best ways to get to Rome main spots from the hotel and back, from that moment on location stopped being an issue. The rooms were not big, but they were clean and cozy, easy access to the internet, but what really made the difference was the restaurant! We planned of dinning in a different place every day as typical tourists do, yet we decided to try the Hotel restaurant the first night and never dinned elsewhere. The quality of food, the service and the prices where unbeatable. Soon we realized that it was not just us, we were meeting the same people every night, everyone in the Delle Muse was doing the same! By the end of our stay, we were in a first name basis with the staff…it was home away from home. We went on to visit other cities Italy and stayed in other hotels with more stars… we always missed Delle Muse. If the coin we tossed in the fountain works its magic and we ever return to Rome, we will most certainly be staying at Delle Muse Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL & STAFF EXCELLENT WOULD CERTAINLY VISIT AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: zaraDurham
Reviews.Content: From the start of our stay hotel staff from management to cleaners could not have been more helpfull & courteous room cleaned every day bedding changed every 2days towels as often as reqd ., excellent sellection for buffet breakfast excellent restaurant serving lunch dinner & snacks, location very good 2 mins. to bus route to visit all of the many attractions in Rome very enjoyable stay even volcanic dust could not spoil it PHIL&MARY DURHAM ENGLAND

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: specialed08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great hotel, and good location. Its in the quiet residential area. You can take the city bus here, there is a pharmacy right across the street and restaurants in walking distance. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Roma. The staff was very friendly and helpful to a new Roma visitor, and the restaurant on site was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, nice neighborhood, could be closer to the city”
Reviews.Author: Quincy56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Della Muse over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was somewhat of an adventure to get there by train and bus. The buses are at the far opposite end of Termini station where the Leonardo Express comes in, not as close as the directions on the web site suggest. Also get off at the stop just after the gas station, the next to last stop and walk up the hill. Closer than the last stop. Breakfast was nice and included with the room. We never ate at the hotel but chose to go out instead. There are several very nice restaurants within a 5 to 10 minute walk, so you don't need to get on the bus for dinner. As for the staff at the hotel, George was very helpful suggesting plans to see Rome. The bed was very hard, but not so bad we couldn't sleep. A bit noisy some days. The neighborhood was mostly residential and seemed very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanboro
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The breakfast buffet was the best out of all the hotels I stayed in, the rooms were clean although basic, they had an English news channel so we could catch up on events, they had free internet in the lobby and the service in the restaurant was very, very good. As others mention, the location is a bit of a problem but I guess you can't have everything. We ended up walking from the the trams at Hungeria (I think that is what the main intersection was called) rather than waiting for they mythical 360 bus and it was only about 10 minutes. There aren't many restaurants or shops close by - you have to walk back out the Hungaria for that. The staff was very friendly and they all seemed very happy and good natured so it must be a good place to work. I think an extra bus ride is worth it when you know you are going back to a quiet, clean and comfortable hotel at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Some trips are blessed; this was one, beginning with our stay at Hotel delle Muse.”
Reviews.Author: kciannella
Reviews.Content: 10 family members, ages 4, 17, 20, 50's, 88, 91, traveling to Rome in July to meet relatives for the first time and visit their ancestral town, Montescaglioso, 6 hours south of Rome, could spell disaster, but was pure delight thanks to Giorgio Lazar, the Lazar family, and staff of Hotel Delle Muse. Before we left the USA, Giorgio communicated through emails and a phone call to arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel for each group in the family arriving on different days from different parts of the USA. He gave us five rooms on the same floor of this charming hotel located in a quiet, cooler, residential area, very accessible to Rome's center. As well, Giorgio arranged for a bus and driver (who quickly became part of the family) for our overnight trip to Montescaglioso. The gracious (English speaking) staff was always kind, attentive, informative. The hotel provides a safe in each room for valuables. We were advised on different methods of travel to various sites in Rome. The surrounding neighborhood has a variety of shops, including home made gelati, and a health food store! Breakfasts at Hotel delle Muse are delicious: fruits, cheese, meats, eggs, pastry, cereals, yogurts, juices, fresh milk, cappucinos, lattes, an array of teas. With the help of the hotel staff, we planned a special dinner (cooked to perfection by the hotel chef) for our Roman relatives and served in the hotel's elegant garden. The rooms are spacious, clean, quiet, air conditioned, (and, if preferred, windows that open into the fresh night air). Giorgio also directed us to some of the neighborhood's restaurants where he takes his own family. Each one of us, from the 4 year old to the more experienced ages of our parents, 88 and 91, felt at home, relaxed, attended to by the kind staff at Hotel delle Muse. My parents enjoyed sitting outside, reading the newspaper, and watching the neighborhood go by when they weren't visiting the gardens and museum at nearby Villa Borghese, or accompanying the 4 year old to the zoo or Vatican City. Each of us knows we have a home away from home at Hotel delle Muse the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Delle Muse- A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld075
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Rome prior to our cruise and thankfully found Hotel Delle Muse. The moment we stepped into the lobby, we were welcomed by the staff, and for the next three days, their help in making travel arrangements, great breakfast, clean and very comfortable accomodations made our stay in Rome wonderful. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was great, which it was. We have never posted a review on Trip Advisor, however did research the web site previously. We recognize there are many hotel choices in Rome, and next time we visit, we will be staying at Hotel Delle Muse and recommend you do as well. Cathy and Rich

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bratu2k2
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for the money. The room was very pretty and large (no too crazy about the shower though), staff was very helpful and accommodating, breakfast was excellent. We also ordered dinner at the hotel restaurant twice, and the food was delicious and very well priced. As far as the location is concerned, based on the reviews, I expected it to be farther from Termini than it really is. I don't think it is any farther from Termini than any other neighborhood hotel, such as Campo de Fiori or Trastevere. The only inconvenience, is that 360 bus does not come too frequently. We took it at different times of the day and we always waited more than 1/2 hour, and on Sunday we waited 1 hour for it. So, if you need to catch a plane on Sunday, make sure to leave extra early, as you don't know how long you will have to wait for the 360. On a different note, there are many other ways to get to the hotel: tram 19, tram 3 or the train that you take from Flaminia (i believe) and in 2 stops you are at Aqua Acetosa, which is 10-15 min leisurely walk to the hotel. We tried everything to avoid taking the 360 and it was a lot of fun exploring... :) We would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gooddeals
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful week in Rome staying at the Hotel Delle Muse. We were so happy to have made this hotel our choice. From FCO we took the train to the Termini and then took the 360 Muse bus. The bus ride was only about 20 minutes and quite comfortable and quiet. The hotel is between two stops, Salvini and Muse within only 2 easy walking blocks. On arrival the reception staff was very welcoming and spoke excellent English. We were told our room was not ready yet but we could wait in the lounge and have coffee or other drink while we wait. Being travel weary, this was appreciated. Our wait was only about 10 minutes, enough time to have our drinks, when the key was brought to us. Our room was on the 2nd floor and even though they have an elevator, we took the stairs which were easy. On opening the door, we both were wowed by the large size room and how well decorated and clean it was. The bathroom was a very good size with a heated towel rack,hair dryer and window. The best surprise was to have a private large terrace out the large french doors. The terrace was above the outdoor restaurant garden which was not in use since it was March so it was a very quiet place to sit and relax. The doors/windows also have the additional shutters that darken the room completely when closed. The room was so comfortable, quiet and dark that we actually overslept one morning, which we never do and were shocked at the time. I also enjoying walking in the morning and found this to be a quiet and safe residential area. All the staff at the hotel are friendly,courteous and helpful. We were always greeted coming in and leaving and were given good directions on the best transport ways to the sights. The hotel has a wonderful and large breakfast buffet with everything you could want. He was always making sure all was set out plentifully and would accommodate special requests from guests. We were able to have such a large breakfast that we could tour all day and only have a snack and dinner. This is a big cost savings. Most all travel was done by bus to the main Termini and then the metro or buses to the places we wanted to go. The metro is efficient but covers a small area but the buses are everywhere and very easy to navigate. We were surprised that we were always feeling safe and comfortable on the buses and it gave us time to review our map and tour plans and see some beautiful parts of the city while on route. On leaving the staff discussed the transportation options for getting to the airport and we decided to have them arrange a transport shuttle for us since we had an early morning flight. The cost was 47Euros for a pleasant 40 minute ride in a Mercedes with a very handsome and congenial driver. We left Rome feeling treated to a luxurious holiday week. We hope for a return trip and another stay at Hotel Delle Muse.

Reviews.Title: “a bit far from the center, but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikes66682
Reviews.Content: The hotel's a bit farther from the center than I'm used to, but that's the place's only real drawback. Still it's only about 35 minutes by bus to Termini Train/Bus Station, and a brief streetcar ride from the Vatican. It's in a quiet residential neighborhood but there are still cafes/shops nearby. I got a room with a balcony, and found it really relaxing to go out on the balcony with a glass of Italian wine and just gaze up at the stars in the evening. The hotel has a nice restaurant, they do a phenomenal breakfast, the staff are incredibly nice and very helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: dmj0311
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel based on low price alone, then this one will do. But it was not very close to the attractions in Rome, a twenty minute bus ride from the Termini train station. Although the bus did run frequently so it was not a long wait for one on any of the days we were there. But the hotel is very old and outdated and the lobby smelled like a litter box. The staff was friendly and helpful when it came to giving directions and such. Breakfast was included in the price and it was a very good value, plenty to eat. But the next time I am in Rome I would spend a couple of dollars more to stay at a nicer, cleaner hotel closer to the Termini Station or the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Beverley_9
Reviews.Content: The criteria for choosing an accomodation, for me, is as important as the place I come to visit over & over again. Rome is at the top of our list, so the decision for my husband and me to celebrate both our milestone birthdays there, came naturally for us. Just as staying in Hotel delle Muse has been the best decision every time. Giorgio Lazar, the hotel's owner, and the wonderful reception & service staff have always been very gracious to us. We have come to appreciate them over the years. In the numerous times that we have stayed in Hotel delle Muse, we could not wait to go to breakfast every morning or come back from a hectic day, knowing there will be great food waiting for us back in the hotel's dining room. Its location in a quiet residential district is very ideal as we enjoy the idea of going around Rome like locals do- using public transportation & discovering new & exciting places along the way. Muse is our home away from home. We can't wait to go back and see familiar & friendly faces once again.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: depal
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel that I have ever been. It was horrible, rusty. My family and I could 'n stay there not even for 1 hour. we end up on the street walking until we found something better. truly some third world countries have cleaner hotel than the Rome Delle Muse.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jctwizzer
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel in a quiet area. But 15 minutes from central transportation hub via bus 360. Staff was friendly and helpful; free breakfast filling; and we had two nice dinners at the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: drfueralle
Reviews.Content: We made a trip to Rome for 3 days and due to the fact, that we sent our guests to this place, when they planned to visit Rome, we did the same for ourselves. The hotel is located in a very quiet area, so that at night nothing disturbed our sleep. The rooms are spacious, very clean and we had the room # 121, which has an own terrace, where you can sit in the evening and having also breakfast served from the room service. The bus # 360 stops only 100m from the hotel and within 20 minutes we've been in the heart of the city. That was great! In walking distance (app. 10 minutes) we found very good restaurants, whithout tourists, where the roman kitchen was celebrated par excellence. At the arrival we had all needed information about Rome handed out from the front desk. The staff was very clean, friendly and helpful. We only can warmly recommend this Hotel, if you're planning to stay some days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelpharm
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us just stayed there for 4 nights this September. We booked through www.go-today.com (a great booking service by the way) with their taste of Italy tour (also very highly recommended). We read the good reviews but were even more pleasantly surprised when we got there. Like some have said, take the 360 MUSE bus from the Termini station which is (with your back to the station) all the way on your left side a little past the 360 ZAMA bus stop. Once there after check in we took the elevator up with our bags. Just so you know, all elevators in Rome are really small (can fit 3 people tight and maybe a small bag or 2). ROOMS: When we got to the room the room had a strong smell of smoke which makes us nauseous. We told the front desk and they said people aren't supposed to smoke in the room but it happens. They said don't worry about it, they will fix the smell before we get back at night. When we came back at night you would never have known the room smelled like smoke, which we were all very relieved. The key also serves as the power for the electricity (see the pictures in the previous post), and we stuck a folded cardboard in it a couple of times which also works if you need the key. The room we had was a triple and the other people in our party had doubles. The rooms were big enough for the beds but don't expect too much extra room. There's a security box in everyone's room where you can set your own code and put things like your passport and extra money so you don't have to worry about losing it. The beds were singles and enough room for one person. We didn't think the beds were hard, but then again we like firmer mattresses in general. The first 2 nights we were a little cold because they set their ventilation system to either heating or air conditioning and they had not set it to heating yet so all we had was air conditioning. We all thought the bathrooms were big enough and the shower was enough room. They give soap and shower gel and shower caps and bar soap. There is also a hair dryer which looks like a vacuum cleaner hose on the wall that works well. The outlets are a type of electrical converter, but when i tried to plug my straightener in (a USA plug) the left side wouldn't fit, cause that side is a little bigger, so i suggest you bring a power converter for your electronics just in case. INTERNET: The lobby has computers that allow you to go online for free but their wireless internet doesn't work at all. BREAKFAST: Their breakfast was a very pleasant surprise. They had scrambled eggs, raw eggs you can make soft or hard boiled, bacon, ham, cheeses, other meats, yogurt, fruit (kiwi, apples), bread, rolls, cookies, juices, nutella and a coffee machine that makes cappuccino, and two other things. If you want fresh cappuccino or espresso just ask one of the ladies working there, they don't understand english well but are sweet and have no problem making it for you. So the breakfast is not to be missed and is a bit surprising since the italians consider breakfast to be a cappuccino and a pastry. STAFF: The staff is nice, they speak english well and are very helpful. They told use everything we needed to know for how to get around and public transportation. They give you a good map and there's a bunch of free little fat books in the lobby that has maps and interesting things about each of the site which is a good idea to have. TRANSPORTATION: The last stop of the 360MUSE bus stops a little past the hotel. So to walk to the stop, make a right outside the hotel and walk a little uphill. The arriving bus will say 360MUSE but to go to the termini you want the 360ZAMA and since its the last stop the the 360MUSE changes to the 360ZAMA at that stop. Its about a 20min ride to the station where you can get other buses or hop on their subway (they only have 2 lines, either line A or B). It was great that the bus stop by the hotel is the first stop on the way to the train station b/c the last day we had our luggage and had no problem fitting it on the bus. There is also a trolly that can take you to st. peters/piazza popolo (where you can walk to spanish steps or trevi fountain) quicker than the bus. Its about a 5-10min walk from the hotel (opposite direction from the bus, make a left outside the hotel) and it uses the same transit ticket as the buses. You can buy these bus tickets at the newspaper stand you pass on the way to the 360 bus by the hotel or at any tabacchi booth. We paid for the 5 day unlimited pass which i think was around 16 euros (cash). Make sure you put the card in the machine everytime you board a bus/train/trolly b/c the transit police will get on the bus or stand in the train stations and check to make sure you've punched. If you don't you can get a hefty fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel w/ 5-star Staff.”
Reviews.Author: James-Laynie
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3-night Italy trip through European Destinations and picked this hotel by reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. Out of the 2 other hotels we stayed at in Italy (Mediterraneo in Florence and Corte Contarina in Venice) this was probably the best one of the three. While this was a great boutique hotel, I still gave it an average rating only because the bed was actually the worst of the 3 hotels and the shower was really quite small. I read other reviews, but still wasn't prepared. BUT, if you don't think it can get any smaller, it DOES! Our shower at the hotel in Venice was even smaller. And another reason why I gave it an average rating (even though this was my favorite of the 3 we stayed at in Orlando) - I've traveled enough and been to enough "average" hotels in the U.S...and this just didn't compare. So I think the scale that we use to measure is different here in America. So an average rating in Europe is actually VERY GOOD!!! LIKES: This hotel was a little 'out of the way' from the center of Rome. But, I actually liked it. You got to see the outskirts of the city. Major *PLUSES* about this hotel: (1) great staff - extremely helpful when asking for advice on how to get to the different sites in Rome. (2) three computers in the lobby for your use - for free! [The hotel in Florence charged 5 Euro for a half hour! - which we did not pay.] (3) GREAT restaurant in the hotel. It is located outdoors, but is so quaint and romantic. I never got a picture of it, but it was just lovely. Good to Know: The key that is given to you is also the key to the electricity in your room. The guy at check-in failed to mention that you take your key ring (which is just a plastic plate with your room # on it) is supposed to be slipped in this little slot just as you enter your room. This will give you lights, run the air conditioning, and turn on the TV. Dislikes: (1) the bed (in 486 at least) was extremtely hard and uncomfortable. However, after walking around Rome, my husband and I were SO exhausted it really didn't matter. (2) small shower - but, I've read from other reviews that it's not UN-common in Europe. And again, after long and exhausting sightseeing days - the fact that HAVING a shower, we were very happy about. HOW TO GET THERE: From the FCO airport, take the express train to the Roma Termini station. Once you arrive at the station, walk out the station and you will see a bus station ahead of you. Find the ticket office and buy a ticket. You'll want to take the 360 bus towards Delle Muse. Just as the hotel's website says, it's the last stop. Where do you find the 360 bus you ask, amongst ALL the other buses...as you came out of the station, it will be on your left, almost alongside the road. There are 2 360 buses now - one going one way on the route and the other one going towards Delle Muse. So look for the #360 bus sign that has the arrow pointing down towards MUSE and not ZAMA. Pictures are included.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: msjen7
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel delle Muse in the Parioli district of Rome. It was fantastic! The hotel itself was beautiful, very large and comfortable rooms, great restaurant and food, and most importantly a wonderful staff! The employees were extremely friendly and helpful in everyway! From our first welcome, to information about the city, and even arranging tours for us-they were great! Having the hotel in a suburban district is also nice to get away from the constant noise and traffic of the city. It was only about 10 euro for a taxi to the Spanish Steps, which is within walking distance from everything. So far this was my favorite hotel in Italy! Highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little place!”
Reviews.Author: ArmchairGypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked the hotel after reading the reviews on this site and found it was every bit as lovely as people described it. Rome is expensive and at 110-140 Eur, these rooms are well worth it. For this amount, our other options were upscale hostels or not so great centre of town hotels. Now Rome itself seemed quite small to us having visited other large cities around the world. So though Delle Muse is not centre of town, it costs just 10 Eur to get you to the heart of the action(the Colosseo, Trevi, Spanish Steps etc.) and we found the time saved by taking the cab was worth it. We got the most wonderful room that had its own little balcony with a few chairs and a table overlooking a tree and some greenery downstairs...we could sit out and have an evening drink or a morning coffee - a luxury by any standards! I think it was Room 138. Also rooms are air conditioned, something not all 3-4 star places offer in Italy in May! Most turn on their air conditioning only in July and August though it was already 33 deg C in May! Breakfast was fair with bacon, scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheeses and the usual mix of cakes and cornettos(crossaints), tea, coffee and juices tht one sees in most Italian hotels. Service and the staff were very friendly, helping us with directions, recommendations and calling us a taxi. We tried dinner at the hotel, the spumante they offered us complimentary was lovely and service was pleasant. The food is not something i would reccomend too highly, a litle bland and loaded with olive oil. I'd suggest bringing in takeaway and enjoying dinner on the darling balcony outside your room(if you manage to get one with a balcony)...more romantic too! They have a lift which may be handy for older folks though it is about the size of my refrigerator at home :) For 20 somethings like us, the stairs are easy enough. I would recommend this charming little place to my friends in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travellerBrabant
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 boys and stayed 4 nights in a family room in Delle Muse. We were disappointed about this hotel, esp. after having read many positive comments. The room was small and very simple, but clean. The interieur of the hotel was very simple overall and needs refurbishment. Also the breakfast was not nice - no fresh bread, awful coffee, fruit out of can. The pizza's and pasta's were okay. And the personnel is friendly. Overall I would not recommend this hotel - it is not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet 3star 20 min by bus away from city”
Reviews.Author: germantouristcouple
Reviews.Content: Had three nights there (for 110 E per double incl breakfast / internet-booking) and experienced exactly what "vansanto" wrote about his stay in March 08: hotel in a quiet area, with helpful service, small but nice and functional rooms, wi-fi, rich buffet-breakfast, etc. The. 20-Min bus ride from Termini station to the hotel (Nr. 360 to final stop "Musee") wasn't a problem to us. Also got to St. Peters within 35 min by changing to tram 19 at Piazza Ungheria. Our 2nd floor room even had a terrace with table and two chairs shaded by big trees. Definitely enjoyed the stay and would return to this hotel at our next Rome-visit

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Giorgio”
Reviews.Author: vansanto
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our third visit to Rome, and as on previous visits we stayed at the Hotel Delle Muse, in the Parioli neighborhood in the northern part of the city. This time, we took our 14-year-old nephew Joshua and his father, Roger. Our plan was to share the beauty, excitement and history that is Rome with Joshua. The Hotel Delle Muse is a family owned and operated business, headed by Giorgio Lazar. It is located on a quiet residential street that reminds me of New York's upper east side, but without the traffic. The standard rooms are small, as in most true European hotels, but we booked two larger rooms. Our room also featured a large whirlpool bath -- a big hit with my wife. Breakfast is served from 7:00 to 10:00 AM daily. The scrambled eggs and bacon were good, but the cheeses, meats and pastries were exceptional. This wonderful breakfast is included in the price of the room. The restaurant also serves lunch and dinner. It was good -- after many long hours of travel -- to check in and then meet in the restaurant for a fine Italian dinner. The food is very good and priced well. We also made use of room service, which is prompt and courteous. We also tried two restaurants recommended by Giorgio. We had two meals at Osteria Della Frezza -- both were excellent. Our last night in Rome, we all had the seven-course sampler menu at Antico Arco Ristorante. What a marvelous meal! Both places were thoughtful recommendations, traditional Roman restaurants, not tourist-oriented. We also had lunch at Caffe Parnaso, two blocks up the hill from the hotel. Good food and a great view! If you attend an event at Parco della Musica, I would recommend an after-theater dinner at Ristorante Red, just a few steps from the concert halls. Both the service and the food are excellent. Back to the hotel: I have to add that the staff at the front desk were very helpful. The desk is staffed 24 hours, and English is spoken as well as many other languages. There also are Internet stations available in the lobby. The hotel arranged for a car to and from the airport, which I would recommend. The dollar being so weak against the Euro these days, our trip was more expensive than we had planned. The hotel helped, though, with several five percent discounts: for reserving via the Internet, for a seven-night stay, for being a returning guest (a "fidelity" discount), and -- if we had had enough Euros at the end of the stay -- for paying cash. This was our third stay at the Hotel Delle Muse. We are already thinking about a fourth visit, and recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a wonderful Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay here for 3 nights , it was like a grand finale of our vaca”
Reviews.Author: BusinessBelgium
Reviews.Content: we got a recommendation for delle Muse from Mr. Aizenman www.Italy-vacation.com as part of our Vacation Italy /Toscana . enjoyed our stay here for 3 nights , it was like a grand finale of our vacation . the warm Hospitality and the quite safe location were great . Buffet breakfast was rich and unique . we travel a lot and sure intend to come back again , our stay in other hotels of Rome was Noisy Mr. Giorgio was very helpful , we used the Internet point free while in other places they wanted to charge us allot . Our lunch in the Garden was also a Great surprise . one evening we walk to Oro’Isola d’ L at via Salaria 180 one of the best sea food restaurants we ever been , 10 minutes walk from the hotel . to summarize , we enjoyed our stay here for 3 nights , it was like a grand finale of our vacation . Jacob

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: capsfan2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in November, 2007. Located in a residential area in the northern part of Rome. Very quiet area which was very nice. My single room was average size for a single but was 1 1/2 levels which was a little odd. You entered the room and had a small desk and bathroom and then went down 8 stairs to the bed and tv. Small bathroom with compact shower. Older hair dryer but worked well. Free maps at desk and free high speed internet in rooms (if you didn't bring a cable you can get from the front desk). Wireless available in the lobby. (However, the last day I was there they were having internet problems so no internet available-I think they just needed to restart their modem but they didn't seem to know what to do.) They also had 3 computers in the lobby for guest use. Has a small elevator. 3 English tv stations (MTV, CNN, Fox News) in rooms. Has restaurant on site. Free hot and cold breakfast in the morning. Need to take bus or taxi to get to the sites. Some cab fares I paid: 10 E to Vatican; Quoted 70 E from Airport but the hotel quotes 40 E to Airport; 10 E to Colessium; 12 E to train station (I paid 12 E coming from the hotel-I think I got hosed by having to pay 30 E from the station to the hotel unless hotel has some deal with a cab company). I would have rated higher if there hadn't been internet problems and because of location. Good property but not convenient for site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonevolving
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! Situated in a quiet suburb north of Rome, this hotel is quiet, modern, and comes with a most gracious and helpful staff. Just being able to sleep in a quiet neighborhood, far from Rome's eternal noise was an enormous gift in itself. But the hotel is elegant, and the staff is outstanding. They gave me an internet cable, brand new, when the wi-fi wasn't working. No charge. They also have a lovely spread for breakfast, and the dinner we had in the restaurant was both delicious and economical. You take the 360 bus down to Termini, and it does add 20-30 minutes on your travel time around town, but I think the gains of the hotel are beyond worth it. Anyone who's stayed around Termini knows that it is both noisy and rundown. Room 250 in the Delle Muse has a delightful full bath and balcony overlooking the courtyard. Under the full moon, I thought this was the best hotel I'd stayed at in Italy. If you walk up to the Plaza to catch the bus, be sure to take in the view of the city. Shopping is quite close by and convenient as well. All in all, I think this hotel is a star in Rome, and though I hate to let the secret out, I think it's the perfect place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mmissner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week trip to Italy and we stayed at the Hotel Delle Muse in Rome for 7 nights. We requested a room with private bath, a tub, no smoking and quiet and we had such a room. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are somewhat stark. I don't remember any paintings on the walls. Ceilings are high. The bathroom was very moderm with bidets and we had a spa bathtub which I enjoyed as well as a shower. This was actually a triple room as there was an extra single bed. The housekeeping was excellent. The room was spotless and the housekeeper seemed to anticipate our needs. We took the extra pillow from the extra bed and the next day when our room was made up, we each had two pillows and the extra blanket we used was added to the made up bed. It seemed to me that sheets were changed daily as they were always very crisp. Towels were nice enough, with face towels and bath towels. The room floor was tiled and the halls are carpeted which could use replacement. It got quite cold and the heat is not usually turned on until November 1. After a day of cold, we did get heat. Breakfast, included in the price of the room, offered a huge variety of food. There were all kinds of rolls, cheeses, fruit-dried, stewed, baked, fresh, canned, eggs, bacon, other meat, juices, all kinds of coffee and more. It is served in a very nice room and the staff is very nice. The 360 bus stopped a block away and went to the main station Termini. This worked out well except for the Saturday when there was a big demonstation at the Termini. It took about 20 minutes to get downtown depending on traffic. The location of the hotel is a plus and a minus. It is in a neighborhood just north of the Borghese Gardens, which is a walkable distance, taking a bit over a half hour. The Pariole neighborhood is very quiet and away from the touristy areas That is the plus. There are a few but not many restaurants that we could find in the area. However, the location is also a minus in that it is not close to all of the sights. We found that once we came back to the hotel, which was often in the late afternoon or early evening, we did not want to go out again. Had we been downtown, we could have come back to the hotel to rest in the afternoon and gone out again. In any case, we highly recommend the Hotel Delle Muse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, imperfect location”
Reviews.Author: ribrabrobro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel in October, 2007. The service is excellent, the staff gracious and helpful, the room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet is generous. All in all it would be the perfect hotel except that it is located so far away from the rest of the city. We had to allow for an hour to get to the main sites of Rome - and that involved a bus ride and a very long walk. We ended up relying on taxis because of the inconvenient location. If you can get this hotel at a good price, I recommend using the savings for taxi rides. Otherwise, I would consider staying closer in to town.

Reviews.Title: “A lucky find”
Reviews.Author: hcetel
Reviews.Content: How fortunate to have found this hotel during a search of the web. my family of 4 had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 8 nites in july, 2007 The staff were beyond helpful in their desire to create an atmosphere that was so friendly. After 8 nites we departed as friends. The room was spacious and easily accomodated my family of four. All other rooms in my travels throughout Italy required the purchase of two rooms. The restaurant was wonderful for dinner. The breakfast facility had a fabulous variety of foods. One morning we were too late for breakfast, but the staff opened the room just for us. Long before we arrived at this hotel, the owner via the internet was so helpful in making recommendations for places to visit in rome. This is a family run hotel, and it runs with a real desire to make the guest feel like family. There is a computer in every room with free internet access. I never heard of this in all my travels. I can not imagine coming back to Rome and staying at anyother hotel... I hope you enjoy your stay at the Hotel Delle Muse as much as I did.. howie.. cherry hill, nj, usa

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Problem Location”
Reviews.Author: FarVistas
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a fine place to stay, if it were only in the center of Rome. Some reviewers seem not to have minded the combination bus and train that it takes to get into Rome by public transportation - our party of 4 found this tedious. We ended up taking taxis to and from the city center each time we went there, which added perhaps $10-$15 each way. The hotel itself was lovely, the staff was helpful, the birds sang beautifully outside our window each day. About a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel was Taverna Rossini (54 Viale G. Rossini, tel. 0684242903, [--]), a truly excellent local restaurant where we returned again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: SicilySue
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel has the most welcoming and helpful staff of any we dealt with in our Italy travels. My sisters and I were traveling on our own and felt very well looked after during our stay here. True, it is located in an out-of-the-way section of Rome, north of Borghese Park, but at the end of a busy, crowded day in Rome this hotel was blissfully clean, quiet and peaceful. The breakfast buffet was extensive, with plenty of protein choices, fuits and pastries, and the restaurant open for lunch & dinner was excellent, also. The shower was a little inconsistent (pressure up & down), but we considered this to be a minor inconvenience when compared to the overall quality of our stay. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and unreservedly recommend it to any travelers looking for good quality and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: JayeffSydney
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome in a few decades, I wanted to stay away from the vast crowds of tourists and hawkers, and the Hotel delle Muse was a good choice. The room was large and well appointed, with a good bed, small but excellent bathroom - and great breakfast! It's on a bus route to the centre of activity - and the tram is a ten minute walk away. The management was attentive and helpful. The hotel is about 15 minutes' walk from the Parco della Musica where I attended a concert, and that was handy. It's not necessary to stay on the Spanish Steps or with the Pope to enjoy Rome - it's great to get away from all that noise to a suburban area which offers more relaxation. The Hotel delle Muse was perfect in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: batshevah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this delightful hotel towards the end of November in 2006. Although this is considered off season in Italy, the hotel was busy with guest arriving and departing regularly. Specifically, I noticed that the hotel had many Italian guests which I found particularly telling of their popularity among locals. The staff was very helpful and patient from beginning to end. Unlike many Italian locals who may have a tendancy for impatience, and even dislike for americans, I found the staff pleasant and down to earth. The room was spacious and simple, clean and bright. Any request I made for blankets or towels was answered within minutes regardless of the time of night. The rates are very reasonable. Although many people may complain about the slight distance from the center, I found it delightful to have the peace and quite. A bus is found regularly up the block, and there are always taxi's. I would suggest looking where you walk on the streets of rome as dog owners don't clean up after themselves in public. The dining staff was very professional and attentive. The breakfast is decent, although the eggs are a bit watery, but there is variety. The only improvement I would suggest is the breakfast, lunch and dinner. Perhaps it is just my own taste, coming from New York, but my own experience was that the main dishes need some life and zest, but a great bargain with unlimited veggies and salads which was fresh and delicious. I found that the tap water was just as clean as the bottled water, so I drank both throughout my stay. My last night was refunded because I stayed with a friend, without any problems whatsoever, unlike other hotels which would only refund a portion (i cancelled last minute). Lastly, there is 24 hour free internet access which was very helpful. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraElizabeth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I haved stayed at this hotel twice, first in the heatwave of July 2003, and again in Easter 2005, both for 6 days. Hotel delle Muse was highly recommended by other Canadian travellers who have stayed there many times. This is the perfect little family run hotel you always hope you will find in Europe: sincere and helpful staff, spotless rooms, generous breakfast with great variety, quiet and safe neighbourhood, close to transit, and excellent rates which can be improved upon by booking directly and paying cash. What a pleasure it was to leave the heat and bustle of downtown Rome and return to the delle Muse! Our second trip to Rome in the Spring allowed for pleasant walks through the parks to the Spanish Steps and beyond. We stayed late downtown once after going to the opera and took a taxi back which was a reasonable 9 Euros, otherwise we always took public transit. The Lazar family is always available to give advice and directions. We chose the same large double and were very happy and will return!

Reviews.Title: “splendid budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feldenstein
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Muse was a wonderful base for us on our 12 night stay in Rome at the end of April and the start of May 2006. We paid in the low 90's euro for a mini double, taking advantage of a 5% cash discount and a 5% internet discount to get it that low. In trying to find a hotel for the time less than a week after Easter through mayday, about a month before our trip we pretty well hit a wall. Virtually everything was booked or quite expensive. The place we had stayed at and liked in the fall a couple years earlier (Hotel Parlamento) was, due to season, both more expensive and unavailable. We poured over trip advisor, the web, and virtually every guidebook published on Rome in the USA. We considered strange plans like camping or staying in the hotel where one had to give up one's room during the day for train workers. We considered neighborhoods we really didn't want to stay in, said goodbye to the humble dream of an in room bathroom, and then, at our darkest hour, we found Delle Muse. It seemed too good to be true. We emailed. They emailed back! They had a room. We confirmed by phone (having to call back when one of the English speakers was there). We had our small double with bathroom en suite for fewer than 100 euros. Huzzah! Literally we walked around for a couple days wondering if we really did have the room until we forced ourselves to knock it off. Good thing too, because everything they told us at Hotel Delle Muse was entirely reliable. Reading ahead of time enough positive things about Hotel Delle Muse left us with only one serious concern about it: location. I’ll try thus to go into a bit of detail about that. Where is this Parioli District where lies the Hotel Delle Muse? Well, look in your guidebook map of Rome. Hmm, it probably cuts off somewhere in the middle of the villa Borghese (that big park). Some books don't cut off until we're just a teensy bit north of there. How nice! We’ve sort of just barely made it to Parioli. We really need to go a bit north and east now to get to our beloved hotel. So what does this mean? Just how far out are we? It all depends on you. Don’t much like being on your feet? I can't recommend Rome for you at all. Want to see the best art in the world and drink the best coffee and eat the greatest pizza, but not a great walker? well, get over it as much as you can, employ what public transportation you can (I like the tram best- a mile walk, take it towards the Vatican and get off just before it turns to head over the river. this puts you out just beyond Piazza del Popolo, the north edge of the central city, the heart of Rome, most of the best stuff. There's also a bus quite near the hotel that goes to Termini and beyond, and there's a moderate walk (a mile or less?) to a train station (Aqua Acetosa?) that seems to not come all that often and goes to, oh, forgive me, I think that train station just north of Popolo). But enough of this. Here are my estimates (very rough) and suggestions for you walkers of cities like myself and my dear wife. You want to get to the park- the Villa Borghese- as your way to the city. I am guessing two miles to that. It is a pleasant, interesting walk through an urban neighborhood of tall apartment sort of buildings. No sights here, but interesting and Rome. At the park begins paradise. Dragon statues, Romans leisuring, pond with rowboats, possible greatest museum on face of planet (Borghese Museum-reservations mandatory) and so on. Our trips between the Hotel and the City Center started out very long and rather confusing and then just got better and better. This is what helped; finally getting a decent map, namely the free one at the hotel, finding the fabulous short cuts (sorry, can’t explain much here, but subway tunnels at mid park can take you right on out to the Spanish steps, or stay up high and take the sort of large pedestrian bridge out to the stunning views over Popolo and the Spanish Steps (and to nice ways down to them)), plus of course, we got stronger! I think maybe 3 miles from Delle Muse to the Spanish Steps or Popolo if you get the best possible route, at once long and not so long. So, about location, on the negative side, well, it is connected, but also set apart. Going home or leaving was always a trip. We were by nature of location less night people as we did not want to come home too late. The park closes apparently (though we never got caught out) and while ways around it are entirely feasible they are longer. We never felt unsafe quite, but it can be pretty desolate walking home at 11 or midnight. Transit definitely shuts or slows down on the earlier side and overall we did not so much manage to use it much for getting home. On the plus side Parioli is nice. The center of Rome is very very intense. It is our favorite city in the world, but I could not imagine going in the summer and in the spring the crowds were, well, sometimes too much. It was nice to go to our genteel neighborhood that was not so intense, to get away from the noise and people. Having a reason for walking through that park most days was lovely. A few blocks from the hotel was a little pizza by the pound kind of stand on Eleanora Duse. It is called Pippos and it turns out I have a white hot passion for it, finding it as good in its own way as Da Baffetto in the central city. Actually we did as well with restaurants there in Parioli as anywhere. I enjoyed both Celestina and La Maremma (?) which are nearly across the street from each other on V.D. Parioli and are sit down pizza and other thing places. So, about the Hotel, I liked its size, big enough to be anonymous and not so personal, but small enough that one could know the staff and, well, this is contradictory, but, be personal. We never ate in its restaurant, though it has one (same place you eat breakfast). I can only say it did not look particularly bad or good. It is a mildly pretty hotel. The staff was very professional and nice, my wife especially liked them and we brought the evening gentleman who was friendly about our rudimentary attempts to say the number of our room, a little plant. We made much use of a little safe deposit box behind the desk. There are internet computers for guest use in the lobby. This is handy for making yet another reservation to go to the Borghese Museum. Our room was small ala Europe budget, but well laid out as it was not retrofitted like the other places we have stayed. The high ceilings helped the feel of the room. The room was clean enough- we’re both pretty easily grossed out- it wasn’t perfect at all, but it was clean and comfortable with a good bed (I suddenly cant remember but think it was a king!). The windows are great, you’ll see, and I don’t mean the view, though it is a nice backyard kind of view. Very small shower, bidet, toilet, good sink, table with chair in room, closet. There appeared to be air conditioning in the room-don’t know if it was extra- we never used it nor would have. Included breakfast is the sort of mixed bag that is diverse enough that you should be able to put together something to suit you if you’re a bit adaptable. You have to ask the waitresses/maids to get you a cappuccino (or due cappuccini) and they will and it will be good. Pretty good croissants and nice tomatoes! Where did they get those tomatoes? Though there weren’t really enough of them. The staff and hotel as a business was polite and fair and reliable. Guests when we were there were mainly European, lots of Italians, but that seemed true everywhere in Rome. Most staff did not speak English, but some did. Based on the rest of the city it was an extremely good bargain, though I cannot speak for the larger rooms. In conclusion, I would say, if you’re not rich or horrified at the location or physically impaired, stay here. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “For the budget-minded traveler!”
Reviews.Author: ronlori
Reviews.Content: Hotel delle Muse is located outside the center of the hustle-bustle of Rome. It is in a quiet neighborhood and a delightful find! The main attractions of Rome are only 10-20 minutes away by bus, metro, or taxi. Convenient internet access, outside cafe on site, and breakfast buffet. The entire staff made us feel welcome and comfortable. We are already looking forward to a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hela1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for visiting Rome. We spent 3 nights there at the end of June. The rooms are newly furnished, the bathrooms are spacious. The hotel is very clean. But most of all they have a wonderful breakfast - which is certainly unusual for Italy. They serve eggs, bacon, different kinds of bread, yoghurt, fresh fruit, and they make various kinds of cofee for you on order. It is true that the hotel is not exactly downtown, however, public transportation is no problem at all. The bus stop is just a few steps away from the hotel and it takes you right to the Termini station, which is very central. Actually, if you stay on the bus no. 360, you can get directly to the Colloseum. The bus runs until midnight and one ticket costs just 1 EUR. We found the location of the hotel convenient because the Parioli district is very quiet. All rooms were air-conditioned. The hotel also has a nice garden where you can have lunch or dinner. The service was excellent and staff was very helpful. Overall we had a great experience and I would return there if I was going to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 30 minutes outside of the historic center of Rome, in a very quiet neihgbourhood. There is a direct connection with the Termini station by bus 360, which passes every 20-30 minutes just a few steps away from the hotel. The rooms are spacious, although we can't really tell exactly, as we had booked a twin bedroom and we stayed in a triple room instead. The rooms are clean and renovated, the staff is very joyfull and helpful, even though most of them do not speak english. The breakfast has a variety of sweets, cakes, hot buffet and there is also a selection for coffees. If you want a cheap but good hotel, then Delle Muse is the right choice. Of course you have to book it through the proper site so as to book it with the better price, as there is a price difference between various sites for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in 2001, and have recommended it to everyone we know going to Rome since. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was fabulous. We had a top floor room directly across from the elevator, which was larger than we expected. THe bathroom was huge with the added bonus of a bidet! Breakfast was wonderful, and got us going for the day. The convenience of the bus made us feel as if we were in the center of things without the noise and bustle of the city center hotels. Overall... the best pick for Rome, and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel della Muse is far from city center.”
Reviews.Author: HenrikRJ
Reviews.Content: Being in Rome for the first time, we tried to find the good deals through the www. Found a hotel that looked nice and with an OK rate, and seemed to be close to the sights. I need to be better to look at the map. This hotel was definately not in walking distance from sights and subway. Only one bus was going close, so we had to rely on that. Longest wait for the bus was late sunday evening, where we spent 35 minuts waiting outside Termini. So if you don't have your own transportation, find something closer to the city, so you can avoid spending your time on and waiting for the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: cosalamx
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in May 2005, and found everything above our expectations. The location is a little out of the way, but the neighborhood is very quiet, and the end of the line for bus #360 is a short block away, but there is almost always a bus sitting waiting for its scheduled start, so there is a place to sit for the few minutes wait until the bus leaves. Never a problem wondering where to get off either. The bus goes to the Termini main train station in about 15 minutes, where you can connect to buses running everywhere in the city. We only had a problem getting a bus back once in the late evening when we had to wait about 20 minutes, but other than that the buses were running every 10 minutes or less. One last point on location - about a 15 - 20 minute walk from the hotel is Piazza Ungheria where there are a few restaurants - one of which we used three of the four days. Can't recall the name but it is around the corner about 4 doors down from the Restaurant Hungaria towards the zoo and is the only one open late at night. Food was very good and inexpensive by Roman standards, although service was spotty. Closer to the Restaurant Hungaria is a take-out pizza spot with a few stools, which sold its pizza by weight, very good and cheap, but it closes early. The hotel is clean and quiet. We had what the hotel described as one of its smaller rooms (which were Eur$20 less per night) and they were certainly sufficient. Not the sort of room where you would want to spend the entire day. The bed was large and comfortable. The front desk staff provided all information requested, and were a pleasure to deal with. We arrived mid-morning and they were apologetic that the room was not ready for us. They gave us a guidebook which had maps and a list of all the bus lines, so we could plan our excursions in advance. One very nice feature was three computers in the lobby available for guest use for internet and email at no charge. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, with many different varieties of buns, croissants and sweet breads, cold cuts, cheeses, yoghurt and cold hard boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved this hotel .”
Reviews.Author: thefahertyfamily
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay on our first visit to Rome in 2002. Georgio and staff were lovely people to deal with - very helpful in every way and the location although about 20 mins by bus from Termini added to our enjoyment - A Family of 3 from Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Little Niche”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Outstanding little hotel but out of the way. On our first visit to Rome, we decided to take a chance on the Hotel Delle Muse, Via Tommaso Salvini 18, 00197 Roma-(Parioli)-Italy. Although I felt like a part of the family before I even arrived, I felt like a stanger walking in. Our room was extremely hot and small but they warned us of this beforehand. Additional fans were provided upon request. But, and this is a big but, Nino (I believe is the owners son), the maid (also breakfast server), and Palo, especially Palo, the waiter are outstanding. The rooms are simple but clean. Amenities are minimal yet adequate. For the price, I highly recommend. We paid $180 Euros per night for two rooms; which included a very nice breakfast. By paying in cash and internet booking, we received a 5% booking for each. For the cost, transportation from the hotel to all sites are economical and easy once you figure out the route numbers. In spite of the heat, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far Away”
Reviews.Author: mmplus
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Delle Muse. The staff is friendly and the room is clean, but rather unattractive. The main problem is the location of the hotel. It is 30 minutes by bus, but the buses are totally unreliable. We waited over 60 minutes on two occasions for the bus to come, and 30 minutes commonly. The neighborhood has very limited eating places. Highly recommend a more centrally located hotel where you can decrease travel time by walking to the sights and where there are more dining options.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel delle Muse
HotelInfo.Address: Via Tommaso Salvini 18, 00197 Rome, Italy
